original: Padasādhanaṃ
translated: The Word-Solving

original: Namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: Homage to the Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Rightly Self-awakened One

original: Buddhambujaṃ namassitvā saddhammamadhu bhājanaṃ,
analyzed: buddha ambujam namassitvā saddhamma madhu bhājanam
translated: Having paid homage to the Buddha’s lotus, the vessel of the honey of the True Dhamma,

original: Guṇamopadapadaṃ saṅghamadhubbatanisevitaṃ;
analyzed: guṇa mopada padam saṅgha madhubbata nisevitam
translated: The foot-place of the honey of the Saṅgha’s virtue,

original: Moggallāyanācariya carañca yena dhīmatā,🔽Kataṃ laghumayandiddhamanunaṃ saddalakkhaṇaṃ;
analyzed: caran ca yena dhīmatā  katam sadda lakkhaṇam
translated: And the practice by which the wise one, the teacher Moggallāna,🔽Made the ladder of the honey of the True Dhamma,

original: Ārabhissaṃ samāsena bālatthaṃ padasādhanaṃ,
analyzed: ārabhissam samāsena bālattham pada sādhanam
translated: I will begin, in brief, the word-solving for the sake of the foolish,

original: Moggallāyanasaddattharatanākarapaddhatiṃ;
analyzed: moggallāyana saddattha ratana ākara paddhatim
translated: The method of the jewel mine of the Moggallāna True Dhamma;

original: Saññāpariggaheneva lakkhaṇesu sarādayo,
analyzed: saññā pariggahena iva lakkhaṇesu sara ādayaḥ
translated: By the discernment of perception, the characteristics and so on,

original: Ñāyantiti tamevādo dassayissaṃ vibhāgato;
analyzed: tam eva adaḥ dassayissam vibhāgataḥ
translated: Are known, thus I will show that itself, divided up;

original: Aādayo titāḷīsa vaṇaṇā.
analyzed: a ādayaḥ titāḷīsa vaṇaṇā
translated: The vowels are thirty-three, the consonants are forty-nine.

original: Jinavacanānurūpā akāradeyo niggahitantā tecattāḷī sakkharā paccekaṃ vaṇṇā nāma honti🔽yathā - a ā i ī u ū e o ka kha ga gha ṅa ca cha ja jha ña ṭa ṭha ṇa ta tha da dha
analyzed: jina vacana anurūpāḥ akāra deyaḥ sakkharāḥ paccekam vaṇṇāḥ nāma honti  yathā a ā i ī u ū e o ka kha ga gha ṅa ca cha ja jha ña ṭa ṭha ṇa ta tha da dha
translated: The consonants are in accordance with the Victor’s words, the vowels are not included, the forty-nine consonants are called the individual letters

original: na pa pha ba bha ma ya ra la va sa ha ḷa aṃ iti-kakārādisvakāro uccāraṇattho = vaṇaṇīyati
analyzed: na pa pha ba bha ma ya ra la va sa ha ḷa aṃ iti kakāra ādi svakāraḥ uccāraṇa atthaḥ
translated: thus - a ā i ī u ū e o ka kha ga gha ṅa ca cha ja jha ña ṭa ṭha ṇa ta tha da dha na pa pha ba bha ma ya ra la va sa ha ḷa aṃ - thus the individual letters beginning with ka are the meaning of utterance = is described

original: attho etehīti vaṇnā-aādi mariyādā bhūto yesanto aādayo.
analyzed: etehi iti mariyādā bhūtaḥ
translated: The meaning is: ‘They are boundaries because of these’. The vowels are the boundaries, and so on.🔽The vowels, and so on, are called ‘boundaries’.

original: Aādayoti vattate yāva “binduniggahīta”nti-tañcakhoattha vasā vibhatticīparināmoti sattamyantamabhisambandhīyate.
analyzed: vattate vasā vasā sattamī antam abhisambandhīyate
translated: The vowels are called ‘boundaries’ in the three wheels.

original: Dasādo sarā
analyzed: sarā
translated: The vowels are of ten colours.

original: Aādisvādimhi niddiṭṭhā odantā dasavaṇṇā sarā nāma honti-yathā-a ā i ī u ū e o = saranti pavattantīti sarā-dasā doti vattate tīsu cakkamānesu.
analyzed: niddiṭṭhāḥ o t antā dasa vaṇṇā sarāḥ nāma honti yathā saranti pavattanti iti vattate tīsu cakkamānesu
translated: The vowels beginning with ‘a’ are called ‘boundaries’ in the ten colours, as follows: a ā i ī u ū e o = they go, they move, therefore they are ‘boundaries’.

original: Dve dve savaṇṇā.
analyzed: dve dve savaṇṇā
translated: Two of each colour.

original: Aāsvādimesu dassu dve dve savaṇṇā nāma honti. Yathākkamaṃ-yathā-aā iti, uū iti, e iti, o iti = samānā sādisā vaṇṇā savaṇṇā-samānattañca ṭhānato.🔽Cha vaṇṇānaṃhi uppattiṭṭhānāni kaṇṭhātālumuddhadantaoṭṭhānā sikāvasena-tesu avaṇṇakavaggahānaṃ
analyzed: dve dve savaṇṇāḥ nāma honti yathākkamam yathā iti iti e iti o iti samānā sādisā vaṇṇā savaṇṇa samāna ttam ca ṭhānato  cha avaṇṇaka vagga hānam
translated: In these ‘a’ and so on, there are two of each colour. As follows: a ā, u ū, e e, o o = the same, similar, colours are ‘same colours’. And the sameness is by place.🔽For there are six places of origin for the colours: the throat, the palate, the lips, the teeth, the nose, and the head.

original: kaṇṭhoṭhānaṃ-ivaṇṇa cavaggayānaṃ tālu-ṭavaggaraḷānaṃ muddhā-tavaggalasānaṃ dantā-u
analyzed: ca vagga yānam danta
translated: In them, the ‘a’ group is from the throat, the ‘i’ group is from the palate, the ‘u’ group is from the lips, the ‘e’ group is from the teeth, the ‘o’ group is from the nose, and the ‘ai’ group is from the head.

original: vaṇṇapavaggānaṃ oṭṭhā-evaṇṇassa kaṇṭhatālu-ovaṇṇassa kaṇṭhoṭṭhaṃ-vakārassa dantoṭṭhaṃ-niggahitassa
analyzed: vaṇṇa pavaggānaṃ oṭṭha aevaṇṇassa kaṇṭha tālu ovaṇṇassa kaṇṭha oṭṭhaṃ vakārassa danta uṭṭhaṃ niggahitassa
translated: The long vowels are: ā, ī, ū, ḷ, ḷī, ḷū, ḷe, ḷo, ḷā, ḷī, ḷū, ḷe, ḷo.

original: nāsikā-ṅañaṇanamānaṃ sakaṭṭhānaṃ nāsikā ca-dvedveti vattate.🔽Pubbo rasso🔽Tesceva dasasu ye dve dve savaṇṇā tesu yo yo pubbo so so rassasañño hoti-yathā-a
analyzed: nāsikā ṅañ aṇana mānam saka ṭṭhānam nāsikā ca dve dve iti vattate  pubbaḥ rassaḥ  tesu ca iva dasasu ye dve dve savaṇṇā tesu yaḥ yaḥ pubbo so so rassa sañño hoti yathā
translated: The first of the two vowels in each of the ten pairs is called short, and the second is called long.🔽The first of the two vowels in each of the ten pairs is called short, and the second is called long.🔽The first of the two vowels in each of the ten pairs is called short, and the second is called long.🔽The first of the two vowels in each of the ten pairs is called short, and the second is called long.

original: i u e o-tesu saṃyoga pubbāca dissanti dve panantimā dīpetuṃ tattha sādhuttaṃ tesampi🔽idha saṅgaho = rassakālayogā tabbantatāya vā rassā-tathā dīghā-idhāpidvedveti vattate.🔽Paro dīgho.
analyzed: saṃyoga pubbā ca dissanti dve pana antimā dīpetum tattha sādhu ttam tesam pi  saṅgahaḥ rassa kāla yogā vā rassā tathā dīghā idhā pidve dve iti vattate  paraḥ dīghaḥ
translated: The first of the two vowels in each of the ten pairs is called short, and the second is called long.🔽The first of the two vowels in each of the ten pairs is called short, and the second is called long.🔽The first of the two vowels in each of the ten pairs is called short, and the second is called long.🔽The first of the two vowels in each of the ten pairs is called short, and the second is called long.🔽The first of the two vowels in each of the ten pairs is called short, and the second is called long.🔽The first of the two vowels in each of the ten pairs is called short, and the second is called long.🔽The first of the two vowels in each of the ten pairs is called short, and the second is called long.🔽The first of the two vowels in each of the ten pairs is called short, and the second is called long.🔽The first of the two vowels in each of the ten pairs is called short, and the second is called long.🔽The first of the two vowels in each of the ten pairs is called short, and the second is called long.🔽The first of the two vowels in each of the ten pairs is called short, and the second is called long.🔽The first of the two vowels in each of the ten pairs is called short, and the second is called long.🔽The first of the two vowels in each of the ten pairs is called short, and the second is called long.

original: Aādisvādibhutesu dasasu ye dve dve savaṇṇā tesu yo yo paro so so dīghasañño hoti-yathā-ā ī ū.
analyzed: a ādi su ādi bhutesu dasasu ye dve dve savaṇṇā tesu yaḥ yaḥ paraḥ saḥ saḥ dīgha saññaḥ hoti yathā ī ū
translated: The first of the two vowels in each of the ten pairs is called short, and the second is called long.

original: Kādayo byañjanā.🔽Aādisu kādayo niggahītapariyantā tettiṃsa byañjanānāma honti-yathā-ka kha ga gha
analyzed: ka ādayaḥ byañjanā 🔽a ādisu ka ādayaḥ tettiṃsa byañjanā nāma honti yathā ka kha ga gha
translated: The first of

original: ṅa ca cha ja jha ña ṭa ṭha ḍa ṇa ta tha da dha na pa pha ba bha ma ya ra lava sa
analyzed: ṅa ca cha ja jha ña ṭa ṭha ḍa ṇa ta tha da dha na pa pha ba bha ma ya ra la va sa
translated: And ṅa ca cha ja jha ña ṭa ṭha ḍa ṇa ta tha da dha na pa pha ba bha ma ya ra la va sa

original: ha ḷa aṃ = byañjīyati attho etehīti byañjanā-kādayoti vattate.
analyzed: ha ḷa aṃ vyañjīyati vattate
translated: ha ḷa aṃ = The meaning is “they cause the letters to be distinguished”, therefore they are called “distinguishing” (vyañjana).

original: Pañca pañcakā vaggā.
analyzed: pañca pañcakā vaggā
translated: The five groups of five.

original: Aādasu kakārādayo makārantā pañca pañcakā vaggā nāma honti-yathā-kakhagaghaṅa, cachajajhaña, ṭaṭhaḍaḍhaṇa, tathadadhana, paphababhama. = Vajjenti yakārādayoti vaggā.
analyzed: a ā dasu kakāra ādayaḥ makāra antā pañca pañcakāḥ vaggāḥ nāma honti yathā ka kha ga ghaṅa ca cha ja jhaña ṭa ṭha ḍa ḍhaṇa ta tha da dhana pa pha ba bhama vajjenti yakāra ādayaḥ iti vaggāḥ
translated: The five groups of five, beginning with ka and ending with ma, are called “groups” (vaga), as follows: ka kha ga gha ṅa, ca cha ja jha ña, ṭa ṭha ḍa ḍha ṇa, ta tha da dha na, pa pha ba bha ma. = They are called “groups” because they cause the letters beginning with ya to be distinguished.

original: Bindu niggahitaṃ
analyzed: bindu niggahitam
translated: The dot is checked.

original: Akārādīsuyavāyaṃ vaṇṇo bindumatto so niggahitasaññohoti = rassasaraṃ nissāya gahitamuccāritaṃ niggahītaṃ.
analyzed: vaṇṇaḥ bindumattaḥ saḥ niggahita saññā hoti rassa saram nissāya gahitam uccāritam niggahītam
translated: In the case of the letters beginning with a, this sound, which is just a dot, is called “checked”. = It is checked when it is pronounced depending on a short vowel.

original: Saññā vidhānaṃ.
analyzed: saññā vidhānam
translated: The rule of the sign.

original: Sandhi vuccate-purisa uttamo, paññā indriyaṃ. Satiārakkho,bhogi indo, cakkhu āyatanaṃ, abhibhu āyatanaṃ, dhanamme atthi, kuto etthā’ tidha-saro lopo sare.
analyzed: sandhi vuccate purisaḥ uttamaḥ paññā indriyam atthi kutas etthā ti dha saraḥ lopaḥ sare
translated: Sandhi is said to be: purisa uttamo, paññā indriyaṃ, satiārakkho, bhogi indo, cakkhu āyatanaṃ, abhibhu āyatanaṃ, dhanamme atthi, kuto etthā’ ti – the sound dha is elided in dha.

original: Saro saro lopanīyo hoti-saretopasilesikādhārasattamī tato vaṇṇakālavyavadhāne kāriyaṃ
analyzed: tatas vaṇṇa kāla vyavadhāne kāriyam
translated: The syllable sa of the word sare is to be elided in the sense of the locative case of the word upasilesaka, and the rule is to be applied after the elision of the syllable vaṇṇa and kāla.

original: na hoti-tvamasi, katamā cānanda aniccasaññā’ti-aññatthāpi saṃhatāyamopasilesakādhā
analyzed: na hoti tvam asi katamā ca ānanda anicca saññā ati aññatthā api
translated: The syllable sa is not elided in the words na hoti, tvamasi, katamā cānanda aniccasaññā. In other words, the locative case of the word upasilesaka is compounded with the word saṃhatā.🔽The locative case is the seventh.

original: reyeva sattamī-vidhīti vattamāne.🔽Sattamiyaṃ pubbassa.
analyzed: reyā iva sattamī vidhī iti vattamāne  sattamiyam pubbassa
translated: The locative case is the seventh of the word pubba.

original: Sattamīniddese pubbasseva vidhiti pubbasaralopo-purisuttamo,paññindriyaṃ, satārakkho,
analyzed: sattamī niddese pubbassa iva pubba sara lopaḥ purisuttamaḥ paññindriyam sa tārakkhaḥ
translated: The syllable sa of the word sare is elided in the sense of the locative case of the word pubba. The words purisuttamo, paññindriyaṃ, satārakkho,

original: bhogindo, cakkhāyatanaṃ. Abhibhāyatanaṃ, dhanammatthi, kutettha. Pubbassa kāriyavidhānā🔽sattamīniddiṭṭhassa paratāva gamyateti paretuparivacanampi ghaṭate-so ahaṃ, cattāro
analyzed: bhogindo cakkha āyatanam abhibha āyatanam kuta ittha pubbassa kāriya vidhānā  sattamī niddiṭṭhassa para tā ava gamyate iti paretu parivacanam pi ghaṭate saḥ aham cattāraḥ
translated: bhogindo, cakkhāyatanaṃ, abhibhāyatanaṃ, dhanammatthi, kutettha are examples. The locative case is the seventh of the word pubba.🔽The rule is to be applied after the elision of the syllable vaṇṇa and kāla.🔽The locative case is the seventh of the word paro. The words so ahaṃ, cattāro ime, yato udakaṃ, pāto evaṃ are examples. Here the rule is applied as “the syllable sa is elided in the sense of the locative case of the word sare”.

original: ime, yato udakaṃ, pāto evaṃ’tīdha-“saro lopo sare”ti vattate.🔽Paro kvaci.
analyzed: ime yatas udakam lopaḥ sara iti vattate  paraḥ kvaci
translated: The locative case is the seventh of the word paro.

original: Saramhā paro saro kvaci lopanīyo hoti-sohaṃ, cattārome, yatodakaṃ. Pātoca-kvacitikiṃ?-Paññindriyaṃ-assādhikāro
analyzed: saramhā paraḥ saraḥ kvaci lopanīyaḥ hoti soham cattāraḥ me yata udakam
translated: The syllable sa of the word sare is to be elided in the sense of the locative case of the word paro in some cases. The words so ahaṃ, cattārome, yatodakaṃ, pāto ca are examples. In some cases, what? The word paññindriyaṃ. The word assādhikāro is an example.

original: sabbasandhisu-tassa idaṃ, tassa idaṃ, vāta īritaṃ, vāta īritaṃ, sīta udakaṃ, sīta
analyzed: sabba sandhi sutassa idam tassa idam vāte īritam vāte īritam sīte udakam sīta
translated: This is his, this is his, the wind is blowing, the wind is blowing, cold water,

original: udakaṃ, vāma ūru,vāma ūru, itidha-pubbasara lope-sare veti ca vattate.
analyzed: udakam vāmaḥ ūru vāmaḥ ūru vā iti dha pubba sara lopa isare vā iti ca vattate
translated: cold water, left thigh, left thigh, here the prefix i is elided before a vowel, and the vowel e becomes o.

original: Yuvaṇaṇānamño luttā.🔽Luttā sarāparesaṃ ivaṇṇavaṇṇānaṃ ño honti vāyathākkamaṃ.
analyzed: yuva ṇa ṇa anamñaḥ luttā  luttā sara aparesam i vaṇṇa vaṇṇānam ñaḥ honti vā ayathākkamam
translated: The ṇ of yuvaṇa is elided.🔽The ṇ of yuvaṇa is elided before a vowel, and the vowel e becomes o.

original: Vaṇṇaparena savaṇṇepi.
analyzed: vaṇṇa parena sa vaṇṇe pi
translated: The word vaṇṇa (colour) is used for the whole colour.

original: Vaṇṇasaddo paro yasmā tena savaṇṇopi gayhati sayaṃ ceti ī ū nampi e o-tassedaṃ, tassidaṃ-vāteritaṃ.
analyzed: vaṇṇa saddo paraḥ yasmā tena savaṇṇaḥ api gayhati sayam ca iti ī ū nam pi e o tassa idam tassa idam vāta īritam
translated: Because the word vaṇṇa (colour) is used for the whole colour, the whole colour is also denoted by it. Sayaṃ ceti means e and o. This is his, this is his, the wind is blowing,

original: Vātiritaṃ-sītodakaṃ, “byañjane dīgarassā”ti dīghe-sītudakaṃ-vāmoru,vāmūru-luttetikiṃ-dasa ime.
analyzed: byañjane dīgarassāti dīghesītudakam vāma uru vāma ūru lutta iti kiṃdasaḥ ime
translated: the wind is blowing, cold water, “Byañjane dīgarassā” (G 1.10) means long: cold water, left thigh, left thigh, elided, what? These ten.

original: Atippasaṅgabādhakassa kvacisaddassānuvattanato na vikappavidhī niyatā-tena upeto’ti
analyzed: ati pasaṅga bādhakassa kvaci saddassa anuvattanataḥ na vikappa vidhī
translated: Because of the obstruction of atippasaṅga, the rule of vikappa is not fixed in some cases due to the influence of the word kvacis. Therefore, in upeto (endowed),

original: evamādīsu vikakeppā nārakitādisu vidhi ca na hoti-ci akāsi, ci akāsi. Su āgataṃ,
analyzed: evamādīsu ca āgatam
translated: and so on, there is no vikappa and no rule in nārakitā and so on. Ci akāsi, ci akāsi. Su āgataṃ,

original: su āgataṃ’tidhayuvaṇṇānaṃ ve’ti ca vattate.
analyzed: su vā iti ca vattate
translated: su āgataṃ. Here the prefix i is elided before a vowel, and the vowel e becomes o.

original: Yavā sare.
analyzed: yavā sare
translated: The ṇ of yuvaṇa is elided.

original: Sare pare iva ṇṇuvaṇṇānaṃ yakāravakārā honti vā yathākkamaṃ-akārassa dīghe-vyākāsi, “vanataragāvā gāmā”ti yāgame-viyākāsi-svāgataṃ. Sāgataṃ-kvacitveva-yānīdha.
analyzed: sare pare iva yakāra vakārāḥ honti vā yathākkamam akārassa vanatara gāvā gāmāti svāgatam sāgatam kvacid
translated: In the words of the first line, the y and v are interchanged, and the a is lengthened, as in the second line.🔽The words vyākāsi, svāgataṃ, sāgataṃ, kvacitveva, yānīdha,

original: Te ajja, te ajja, so ayaṃ, so ayaṃ, itīdha-“yavāsare” ‘ve’ti ca vattate.
analyzed: te ajja te ajja saḥ ayam saḥ ayam iti ca vattate
translated: and te ajja, te ajja, so ayaṃ, so ayaṃ, are formed by the addition of ve to yavāsare.

original: Ñonaṃ
analyzed: ña ūnam
translated: Ñonaṃ

original: Ñonaṃ yakāravakārā honti vā sare pare yathākkamaṃ.
analyzed: ña ūnam yakāra vakārāḥ honti vā sare pare yathākkamam
translated: In the words of the first line, the y and v are interchanged, as in the second line.

original: Tyajja, tejja-“byañjane dīgharassā”tidīghe-svāyaṃ, soyaṃ.
analyzed: tyajja tejja byañjane dīgha rassa ati dīghesu āyam saḥ uyam
translated: The words tyajja, tejja, svāyaṃ, soyaṃ,

original: Kvacītveva-dhanammatthī-go eḷakamitidha-sare’ti vattate.
analyzed: eḷa kam iti dhasara iti vattate
translated: and dhanammatthī, go eḷakam, are formed by the addition of e to sare.

original: Gossāvaṅa.
analyzed: gossāvaṅa
translated: Gossāvaṅa.

original: Sare pare gossa avaṅa ādeso hoti-saca“ṭanubandhāneka vaṇṇāsabbassā”ti sabbassappasaṅge-antasse’ti vattamāne.
analyzed: sare pare gossa a vaṅaḥ ādesaḥ hoti sa ca ṭ anubandha an eka vaṇṇa sabbassa ati vattamāne
translated: In the words of the first line, the a of go is changed to avaṅa, as in the second line. The words saca, ṭanubandhāneka vaṇṇāsabbassā, are formed by the addition of se to sabbassappasaṅge.

original: Ṅanu bandho.
analyzed: ṅ anu bandho
translated: Ñanu bandho.

original: Ṅakāronubandho yassa so nekavaṇṇopi antassa hotiti औkārasseva hoti,-“saṅketonavayavonu bandho”tivacanā ṅakārassāppayogo-payojanaṃ“ṅanubandho”ti saṅketo-gaveḷakaṃ.
analyzed: ṅakāraḥ anubandhaḥ yassa saḥ neka vaṇṇaḥ api antassa hoti ti kārassa iva bandhu ti vacanā
translated: The word saṅketana (convention) is in the locative case, and the word avayavonu (of the part) is in the nominative case.

original: Iti eva, iti evā “tīdha-🔽Vitisseve vā
analyzed: iti eva iti evā  vi tis seve vā
translated: The word iti (thus) is in the locative case, and the word eva (just) is in the nominative case.

original: Evasadde pare itissa vo hoti vā-saca.
analyzed: eva sadde pare itissa vaḥ hoti vā saca
translated: The word vā (or) is in the locative case, and the word itissa (of that) is in the nominative case.

original: Chaṭṭhiyantassa.
analyzed: chaṭṭhiyantassa
translated: The word vo (your) is in the nominative case, and the word chaṭṭhiyanta (of the sixth case) is in the locative case.🔽The word yaṃ (what) is in the nominative case, and the word kāriyaṃ (to be done) is in the locative case.

original: Chaṭṭhinaddiṭṭhassa yaṃ kāriyaṃ tadantassa viññeyyanti ikārassādeso hoti = ṭhānīnamāmaddiyadissati🔽uccāriyati’ti ādeso-itveva, aññatra yādese-“tavaggavaraṇanaṃ ye cavaggabayañā”ti
analyzed: cha ṭṭhi nad diṭṭhassa yam kāriyam tad antassa viññeyyanti ikārassa ādesaḥ hoti  ādesa u itvā iva aññatra ya ādesa i ta vagga varaṇanam ye ca vagga bayañā ti
translated: The word ādeso (change) is in the nominative case, and the word icceva (just) is in the locative case.🔽The word aññatra (except) is in the locative case, and the word yādeso (change) is in the nominative case.🔽The word takārassa (of the letter ta) is in the nominative case, and the word vo (your) is in the locative case.🔽The word yassa (of which) is in the nominative case, and the word cakāro (the letter ca) is in the locative case.🔽The word icceva (just) is in the locative case, and the word du (two) is in the nominative case.

original: takārassa vo-“vaggalayehi te”ti yassa ca cakāro, icceva-du aṅgikaṃ, ci itvā, ajja🔽agge, pātu ahesuṃ, pā eva, idha ijjhati, pari antaṃ, atta atthamitidha-“mayadāsare”ti vattate.
analyzed: takārassa teti yassa ca cakāraḥ aṅgikam ci itvā ajja  agge pātu ahesum pā eva idha ijjhati pari antam atta vattate
translated: The word aṅgikaṃ (the limbs) is in the nominative case, and the word ci (if) is in the locative case.🔽The word ajja (today) is in the nominative case, and the word agge (at the head) is in the locative case.🔽The word pātu (may be) is in the nominative case, and the word ahesuṃ (they were) is in the locative case.

original: Vatataragā cāgamā.
analyzed: vata tara gā ca āgamā
translated: The word pā eva (just) is in the nominative case, and the word ijjhati (is accomplished) is in the locative case.🔽The word pari (around) is in the locative case, and the word antaṃ (the

original: Ete mayadā vāgamā honti vā sare kvaci,-āgamino aniyamepi saroyevāgamī hoti vanādinantu
analyzed: ete maya dāḥ vāgamāḥ honti vā sare aniyame pi
translated: The Saroyeva is also in the Vana, etc., though not in the Niyamas.🔽The Duvaṅgika is the sign, because the words, etc., are otherwise meaningless.

original: ñāpakā-aññathāhi padādīnaṃ yukvīdhāna manatthakaṃ-duvaṅgikaṃ, cinitvā, ajjatagge,
analyzed: ñāpa kāaññathā hi pada ādīnam cinitvā ajja tagge
translated: Having considered, today,

original: pāturahesuṃ, -“byañjanedīgharassā”ti rasse-pageva, idhamijjhati, pariyantaṃ, attadatthaṃ-vātveva-attatthaṃ.
analyzed: byañjane dīgha rassa ati rasse pagā iva idham ijjhati pariyantam attadattham vā tveva attattham
translated: they appeared, “The vowels are long and short.” The Rasse-pageva is only in the Rasse. Here, it is abandoned, the end, one’s own purpose, indeed, one’s own purpose.

original: Cha abhiññā, cha abhiññā,’tīdha-vā sare āgamo’ti ca vattate.
analyzed: cha abhiññā sare āgamaḥ iti ca vattate
translated: The six higher knowledges, the six higher knowledges, here the Vagamā is in the Sarassa.

original: Chā ḷo.
analyzed: chā ḷaḥ
translated: The six are the sixth.🔽The six sounds have the ḷakāra Vāgamā in the Sarassa of another.

original: Cha saddā parassa sarassa ḷakāro āgamo hoti vā-chaḷabhiññā, chaabhiññā.
analyzed: cha saddā parassa sarassa ḷakāraḥ āgamaḥ hoti vā cha abhiññā cha abhiññā
translated: The six higher knowledges, the six higher knowledges.

original: Sarasandhi.
analyzed: sara sandhi
translated: The Sarasandhi.

original: Kaññā iva-kaññā ivā tīdha-pubbaparasarānaṃ lope sampatte-saro paroti ca vattate.
analyzed: kaññā iva kaññā ivā ti idha pubba para sarānam lope paraḥ iti ca vattate
translated: Like a maiden, like a maiden, here, when the elision of the first and last syllables is accomplished,

original: Nadvevā.
analyzed: na tu eva
translated: the Sarassa of another is said.🔽Not even two.

original: Pubbaparasarā dvepi vā kvaci na lupyante-kaññāiva, kaññeva, kaññāva.
analyzed: pubba para sarāḥ dve pi vā kvaci na lupyante kaññā iva kaññā iva kaññā ava
translated: The two, the first and last syllables, are not elided in some cases.

original: Sarasandhi nisedho.
analyzed: sara sandhi nisedhaḥ
translated: The prohibition of the Sarasandhi.

original: Tatra abhirati, khanti paramaṃ, sammā akkhāto’tīdha-
analyzed: tatra abhirati khanti paramam sammā
translated: Therein, delight, patience, supreme, rightly taught, here

original: Byañchane dīgharassā.
analyzed: byañchane dīgha rassā
translated: The long and short in the vowels.

original: Rassadīghānaṃ kvaci dīgharassā honti byañjane-tatrābhirati, khantīparamaṃ,’ sammadakkhāto’ tidāgame rasso-kvacītveca-tyajja-kathaṃ yāniva antalikkhe’ti -dīgharassāti yogavibhāgā.
analyzed: rassa dīghānam kvaci dīgha rassāḥ honti khantī paramam sammadakkhāto ti da āgame anta likkhā iti dīgha rassā ati yogavibhāgāḥ
translated: In some instances long and short are long and short in the case of a consonant, there is delight in that, patience is supreme, the right way is taught, in the scriptures the short is in some instances the long, and the long is in some instances the short, how is it like the sky? Thus is the analysis of long and short.

original: Ci gaho, tatiya jhānaṃ. Vi khopo, itidha-byañjane’ti vattate.
analyzed: ci jhānam vi khopaḥ itidha byañjanā iti vattate
translated: Ci gaho, the third jhāna. Vi khopo, thus it is said in the case of a consonant.

original: Saramhā dve.
analyzed: saramhā dve
translated: Two from saram.

original: Saramhā parassa byañjanassa kvaci dverūpāni honti-viggaho.
analyzed: sa ramhā parassa byañjanassa kvaci dve rūpāni honti viggahaḥ
translated: In some instances two forms are made from the consonant of another, from saram, by viggaha.

original: Catuttha dutiyesvesaṃ tatiya paṭhamā.
analyzed: tatiya paṭhamā
translated: The third and first of the fourth and second.

original: Catutthadutiyesu paresvesaṃ catutthadutiyānaṃ tabbagge tatiya paṭhamā honti paccāsatyāti
analyzed: catuttha dutiyesu paresu esam catuttha dutiyānam tad bagge paṭhamāḥ honti
translated: The third and first of the fourth and second are the fourth and second in the case of another, in its own place, by paccāsatti.

original: pubbajhakārakhakārānaṃ jakārakakarā-tatiyajjhānaṃ, vikkhepo-saramhā’tikiṃ?-Taṃ vanaṃ.
analyzed: pubba jhakāra khakārānam jakāra kakara atatiya jhānam vanam
translated: The j and k of the first are the j and k of the third, the third jhāna, distraction, from saram. What? That forest.

original: Akarambhasete, akarambhasete, eso attho, eso attho, itidha-ce’tivattate.
analyzed: a karambha sete a karambha sete esaḥ atthaḥ esaḥ atthaḥ itidha ca iti vattate
translated: Akarambhasete, akarambhasete, this is the meaning, this is the meaning, thus it is said in the case of ce.

original: E o na ma vaṇṇe.
analyzed: e o na ma vaṇṇe
translated: E o na ma vaṇṇe.

original: E o naṃ vaṇṇe kvaci a hoti vā-akarambhasane, akaramha sete-esaattho, esoattho-vaṇṇetikiṃ?-So.
analyzed: e o nam vaṇṇe kvaci a hoti vā a karambha sane a karamha se te e sa atthaḥ esaḥ atthaḥ vaṇṇa iti kiṃso
translated: In the case of the word vaṇṇa, the vowel a is sometimes elided, as in a-karambha-sana, akaraṃha, seta, esa-attha, eso-attha. What is the meaning of vaṇṇa? So.

original: Sarabyañjanasandhi.
analyzed: sara byañjana sandhi
translated: The sandhi of the consonants and vowels.

original: Ata yantaṃ. Tatha yaṃ. Mada yaṃ, budhi yati, dhana yaṃ. Seva yo, payesanā, pokkharaṇa yo, itidha-
analyzed: ata yantam yam mada yam budhi yati dhana yam seva
translated: Therefore yantaṃ. Thus yaṃ. Mada yaṃ, budhi yati, dhana yaṃ. Seva yo, payesanā, pokkharaṇa yo, thus here-

original: Tavaggavaraṇanaṃye cavaggakhayañā.
analyzed: ta vagga varaṇa naṃye ca vagga kha yañā
translated: The Tavaggavaraṇanaṃ and the Cavaggakhayañā.

original: Tavaggavaraṇanaṃ cavaggabayañā honti yathākkamaṃ yakāre, “vaggalasehi te”ti vaggā
analyzed: ta vagga vara ṇanam ca vagga bayañāḥ honti yathākkamam yakāre vagga lasehi ta iti vaggāḥ
translated: The Tavaggavaraṇanaṃ and the Cavaggabayañā are yakāre in order, “vaggalasehi te” means vaggā

original: parassa yassa pubbarūpaṃ-accantaṃ. Tacchaṃ, majjaṃ, bujjhati, dhaññaṃ, sebbo, payyesanā,
analyzed: parassa yassa taccham majjam bujjhati dhaññam sebbaḥ payyesanā
translated: The vowel a of the preceding is elided. Tacchaṃ, majjaṃ, bujjhati, dhaññaṃ, sebbo, payyesanā,

original: pokkharañño-kvacītveca, matyā-yeti vattate vakkhamānesu tīsu. Saka yate, ruca yate,
analyzed: matyāya iti vattate vakkhamānesu tīsu saka yate ruca yate
translated: pokkharañño-kvacītveca, matyā-yeti this is said in the case of the three that are being stated. Saka yate, ruca yate,

original: paṭyate, lupyate, salyate, disyate’tīdha.
analyzed: paṭyate lupyate salyate disyate iti idha
translated: paṭyate, lupyate, salyate, disyate here.

original: Vaggalasehi te
analyzed: vagga lasehi te
translated: Vaggalasehi te

original: Vaggalasehi parassa yakārassa kvaci te vaggalasā honti.
analyzed: vagga lasehi parassa yakārassa kvaci te vagga lasāḥ honti
translated: Vaggalasehi parassa yakārassa kvaci te vaggalasā honti.

original: Sakkate, ruccate,paṭṭate, luppate, sallate, dissate. Kvacitveva-kyāhaṃ-muha = yatī’tīdha-
analyzed: sakkate yati iti idha
translated: Sakkate, ruccate, paṭṭate, luppate, sallate, dissate. Kvacitveva-kyāhaṃ-muha = yatī’tīdha-

original: Hassa vipallāso
analyzed: hassa vipallāsaḥ
translated: The reversal of h

original: Hassa vipallāso hoti yakāro-muyhati,
analyzed: vipallāsaḥ hoti yakāra umuyhati
translated: The reversal of h occurs with the letter y: muhati,

original: Bahuābādho, bahu ābādho’tīdha-ussavakāre “hassa vipallāso”ti vattate.
analyzed: bahu ābādhaḥ bahu ābādhaḥ ti idha aussavakāre vattate
translated: bahuābādho, bahu ābādho. Here the “reversal of h” is said to occur with the vowel u.

original: Vevā.
analyzed: vevā
translated: Vevā.

original: Hassa vipallāso hotivā vakāre-bavhābādho, bahvābādho.
analyzed: vipallāsaḥ
translated: The reversal of h occurs with the letter v: bavhābādho, bahvābādho.

original: Byañjana sandhi.
analyzed: byañjana sandhi
translated: Sandhi of consonants.

original: Akkhirujati. Akkhirujatī’tīdha-veti vattate yāva“mayadāsare”ti.
analyzed: akkhirujati akkhirujati iti idhavā iti vattate
translated: Akkhirujati. Akkhirujatī’tīdha-veti is said to occur up to “mayadāsare”.

original: Niggahitaṃ.
analyzed: niggahitam
translated: Niggahitaṃ.

original: Niggahītamāgamo hotivā kvaci = ṭhānīnamāliṅgiya gacchati pavattatī’ti āgamo-akkhiṃ
analyzed: niggahītam āgamaḥ kvaci ṭhānīnam āliṅgiya gacchati pavattati iti
translated: Niggahītamāgamo hotivā kvaci = ṭhānīnamāliṅgiya gacchati pavattatī’ti āgamo-akkhiṃ

original: rujati,akkhi rujati-“yāvadvidhā”ti ādo niccaṃ vavatthita vibhāsattā vādhikārassa-vāsaddo
analyzed: ādaḥ niccam
translated: rujati,akkhi rujati-“yāvadvidhā”ti ādo niccaṃ vavatthita vibhāsattā vādhikārassa-vāsaddo

original: hi atthavaye vattate katthaci vikappe katthaci yathāvavatthitarūpa pariggaheti-yadā
analyzed: hi attha vaye vattate katthaci vikappe katthaci
translated: hi atthavaye vattate katthaci vikappe katthaci yathāvavatthitarūpa pariggaheti-yadā

original: pacchime tadā naccamaniccamasantañca vidhiṃ dīpeti-ettha pana kva cisaddassānu vattanato
analyzed: pacchime tadā vidhim dīpeti ettha pana kva ci saddassa anu vattanataḥ
translated: But here, because of the presence of the word “sometimes”,🔽therefore the method of the negative particle is established.🔽The elision of the final.🔽The elision of the final of a prefix is sometimes.🔽The long and the short, the masculine and the neuter.

original: tenevāsantavidhi siddho’ti vāsadde nitaradvayaṃ-saṃ ramho, saṃramho, puṃ liṅgaṃ,puṃ
analyzed: siddhaḥ ti
translated: Here “sometimes” is the rule.🔽“I desire to enter upon meditation” and so on.

original: liṅgamitīdha-niggahītādhikāro ā “mayadā sareti”.🔽Lopo.
analyzed: ā maya dā sara iti  lopaḥ
translated: The elision of the final of another.🔽The elision of the final of another is sometimes.🔽The elision of the final of a compound.🔽The compound is the combination of the consonants that follow. Here the elision of the final of the first member is sometimes.🔽The elision of the final of the first member.

original: Niggahītassa lopo hoti vā kvaci-dīghadittāni, sāramho, sāramho-pulliṅgaṃ, puṃliṅgaṃ-paṭisallāṇe pātukāmo’tiādisu niccaṃ-pupphaṃ assā, pupphaṃ assā, kiṃ iti, kiṃ itī’tīdha-🔽Parasarassa.
analyzed: niggahītassa lopaḥ hoti vā kvacid dīgha dittāni sāramho sāramho pulliṅgam puṃliṅgam paṭisallāṇe pātu kāmaḥ ti ādisu niccam puppham assā puppham assā kim iti kim iti iti idha  para sarassa
translated: “The flower of it, the flower of it” and “what, what” here.🔽The elision of the final of another.

original: Niggahītamhā parassa sarassa lopo hoti vā kvaci.
analyzed: niggahītamhā parassa sarassa lopaḥ hoti vā kvaci
translated: The elision of the final of another is sometimes.

original: Saṃyogādi lopo.
analyzed: saṃyoga ādi lopaḥ
translated: The elision of the final of a compound.

original: Anantarā byañjanā saṃyogo-atra yo ādabhutāvayavo tassa vā kvaci lopo hotī’ti sassādissa🔽lopo-pupphaṃsā, “mayadā sare”ti niggahītassa makāro-pupphamassā, “vagge vagga’nto”ti
analyzed: anantarā byañjanā saṃyogaḥ atra yaḥ tassa vā kvaci lopaḥ hoti iti sassa ādissa  lopa upupphaṃsā maya dā sarā iti niggahītassa makāra upuppha massā vagge vagga anto ti
translated: The compound is the combination of the consonants that follow. Here the elision of the final of the first member is sometimes.🔽The elision of the final of the first member.

original: no naggahītassa-kinti, kimiti.
analyzed: naḥ na ggahītassa kinti kim iti
translated: “The flower of it, the flower of it” and “what, what” here.

original: Taṃ kha ṇaṃ, taṃ khaṇaṃ, dhammaṃ care, dhammaṃ care, taṃ ḍahati, taṃ ḍahati, taṃ dānaṃ, taṃ dānaṃ, taṃ phalaṃ, taṃ elamitīdha-

translated: At that moment, at that moment, one should practice Dhamma, one should practice Dhamma, it burns, it burns, that gift, that gift, that fruit, that fruit, having gone here-

original: Vagge vagganto.
analyzed: vagge vagga antaḥ
translated: In the chapter, it is in the chapter.

original: Naggahītassa kho vagge vagganto vā hoti paccāsatyā-taṅkaṇaṃ,taṃkhaṇaṃ-dhammañcare,
analyzed: nagga hītassa kho vagge vaggantaḥ vā hoti
translated: In the case of the one who is seized, in the chapter it is either in the chapter or it is the truth, at that moment, at that moment, one should practice Dhamma,

analyzed: dhammaṃcare tat ḍahati tat ḍahati tat dānam tat dānam tat phalam tat phalam gantvā sammato ti ādisu
translated: one should practice Dhamma, it burns, it burns, that gift, that gift, that fruit, that fruit, having gone, it is agreed' in such phrases as

analyzed: niccam ānantarikam yam āhu ānantarikam yam āhu paccattam eva paccattam eva tañhi tañhi itidha
translated: It is said to be immediate, it is said to be immediate, it is for oneself, it is for oneself, that indeed. That indeed, here-

original: Yevahisuñño.
analyzed: yeva hi suññaḥ
translated: Just so, empty.

original: Yaevahisaddesu niggahītassaño vā hoti-“vaggalasehi te’ti yassa ñakāre-ānantarikañña
analyzed: ya eva hi saddesu niggahītassa ñaḥ vā hoti vagga lasehi te ti yassa ñakāre ānantarika ña
translated: In the case of the one who is seized by the word eva, it is either eva or 'by you, by you, by you' in the case of the one who has the ñakāra-🔽It is said to be immediate. It is said to be immediate, in the case of the ñakāra-

analyzed: sadda sahacariyāya iti saṃyataḥ iti idha
translated: Because of the association with the word eva, the word eva is included-controlled, controlled, here-

original: Ye saṃssa
analyzed: ye saṃssa
translated: In the case of the saṃ-

analyzed: saṃsaddassa yam niggahītam tassa vā ñaḥ hoti yakāre
translated: The ṅ of saṃsadda is dropped, and ño is substituted for the ya, when the latter is followed by a vowel.

analyzed: saññataḥ gayhate punarbacanā  tam eva tam eva tam idam tam idam tam iminā tam iminā atīdha  maya dāsare  niggahītassa maya dāḥ honti vā sare kvacid tam eva tam eva tay idam tam idam tad aminā  taṃ iminā ettha tad aminā ādīni iti nipātanā ikārassa
translated: Saññato, saṃyato. The repetition of the word is for the purpose of showing that the ṅ is dropped only when the ya is followed by a vowel.

original: Dve dve kānekesu nāmasmā siyo aṃyo nāhi yanaṃ smāsanaṃ smiṃsu
analyzed: dve dve kānekesu nāmasmā siyaḥ aṃyaḥ na ahi sma asanam smiṃsu
translated: In the two, one, and many, the two, the one, and the many are the names. The cemetery is in the one, the many.

original: Etesaṃ dvedve honti ekānekatthesu vattamānato nāma smāti yathākkamaṃ ekamhi cattabbo ekavacanānaṃ bahumhi vattabbe bahuvacanānaṃ cātiyamenappayaṅge-nāmasmā’tiadhikāro.
analyzed: etesam dve dve honti eka aneka atthesu vattamānataḥ nāma sma ati yathākkamam ekamhi cattabbo ekavacanānam bahumhi vattabbe bahuvacanānam ca atiyamena payaṅgena āma sma ati adhikāraḥ
translated: They are two, two, because they occur in the one, the many, the two, the many. The names are the one, the many, respectively. The singular is to be said in the one, the plural in the many. The scope is by the method of the last part.

original: Paṭhamātthamatte
analyzed: paṭhama a ttha ma tte
translated: In the first meaning

original: Sakatthadabbaliṅgāni saṅkhyākammādipañcakaṃ
analyzed: sa kattha dabba liṅgāni saṅkhyā kamma ādi pañcakam
translated: The meaning of the word, the gender, the number, the case-ending, and the five,

original: Nāmattho tassa sāmaññamattamattaṃ pavuccate.
analyzed: nāmattho tassa sāmañña matta mattam pavuccate
translated: The meaning of the name is said to be the mere commonness of that.

original: Nāmassābhidheyya matte paṭhamāvibhatti hoti’ti vatticchāvasā paṭhamāyekavacanabahuvacanāni.
analyzed: paṭhamā vibhatti hotiti vatti chāvasā paṭhamāya ekavacana bahuvacanāni
translated: The first case-ending is in the mere name to be expressed. The scope is by the method of the first case-ending, the singular, and the plural.

original: Siyoiti paṭhamā, sissikārassānubandhattappeyogo-payojanaṃ“ki maṃ sīsū”ti saṅketo-tathā
analyzed: paṭhamā mam
translated: The two is the first. The connection of the two is the purpose of the two. The convention is “What is on the head?” In the same way

original: aṃ vacanassakārassa-si-ato’ti vattate-tassa nāmavisesanattā “vidhibbisesanantassā”ti tadantato vidhi.
analyzed: am vacana ssakāra ssa si a taḥ ti vatta ta itassa nāma visesana ttā tad antataḥ
translated: The letter sa of the word is the si. The rule “ato si” applies. The rule is at the end of that because it is a particular of the name.

original: Sisso.
analyzed: sisso
translated: The head.

original: Akārantato nāmasmā parassa sissa ohoti-pubbasaralopo buddho tiṭṭhati-yo.
analyzed: akāra antataḥ nāmasmā parassa sissa o ha uti pubba sara lopaḥ buddhaḥ tiṭṭhatiyaḥ
translated: The o is added to the si after the name ending in a vowel. The previous short vowel is elided. Buddha remains. The yo.

original: Ato yonaṃ ṭāṭe.
analyzed: a taḥ ya ūnam ṭa ā ṭe
translated: Therefore, at the end of the first and second cases.

original: Akārantato nāmasmā paresaṃ paṭhamādutiyāyonaṃ ṭāṭe honti yathākkamaṃ-ṭakārānubandhattā“ṭanubandhānekavaṇṇā sabbassā”ti sabbādeso-buddhā tiṭṭhanti. ‘Paṭhamātthamatte”tivattate.
analyzed: akāra antataḥ paresam paṭhamā dutiyā yonam ṭa āṭe honti sabbassa ati tiṭṭhanti
translated: After a noun ending in a vowel, the first and second cases have the ending -o, in that order, because of the following of the letter -t-. ‘The ending -t- follows many vowels, and the ending -o is in all cases.’ The Buddhas stand. ‘In the first case meaning “at the time of” ’ is completed.

original: Āmantaṇe.
analyzed: āmantaṇe
translated: In addressing.

original: Saddenābhimukhī kāro vijjamānassa vatthuno
analyzed: saddena abhimukhī kāraḥ vijjamānassa vatthunaḥ
translated: In addressing, the making of the case-ending -o is done by the addition of the letter -t- to the case-ending -a, because of the presence of the base.

original: Āmantaṇaṃ vidhātabbe natthi rājā bhaveti taṃ;
analyzed: āmantaṇam vidhātabbe na atthi rājā bhava iti tam
translated: ‘In addressing, there is no king, he is made to be.’

original: Āmantaṇadhike atthamatte paṭhamā vibhatti hotī’ti ekasmiṃ ekavacanaṃ si.
analyzed: ām antaṇ adhike attha matte paṭhamā vibhatti hoti iti ekasmin ekavacanam si
translated: ‘In the first case meaning “in addressing” the second case-ending is.’ In one, the singular.

original: Gosyālapaṇe.
analyzed: gosya alapaṇe
translated: In addressing.

original: Ālapaṇe si gasañño hoti-lopo’ti vattate
analyzed: ālapaṇe si ga saññaḥ hoti lopaḥ iti vattate
translated: In addressing, the ending -o is known as -s- ‘The elision is.’

original: Gasīnaṃ.
analyzed: gasīnam
translated: Of the -s- endings.

original: Nāmasmāgasīnaṃlopohoti-bhobuddhamaṃpālaya-ge’tivattate.
analyzed: nāma sma āgasī naṃ lopa uha uti bho buddha mam pālaya ga iti vattate
translated: The elision of the -s- endings is. ‘O Buddha, protect me.’ ‘The ge- is.’

original: Ayunaṃ vā dīgho.
analyzed: ayunam vā dīghaḥ
translated: Of the long vowels.

original: ऐu iccesaṃ vā dīgho hoti gepare tiliṅge’tidīgho-buddhā, keci dīghaṃ dūrālapaṇe yevicchanti samīpālapaṇepi dassato taṃ na gahetabbaṃ-yomhi,-buddhā maṃ pāletha.
analyzed: vā dīghaḥ hoti ge pare keci dīgham dūra ālapaṇe ye vicchanti samīpa ālapaṇe pi dassataḥ tam na gahetabbam mam pāletha
translated: Of the vowels -ai- and -au- the long is, in the feminine, in the neuter, and in the masculine. ‘The long is.’ The Buddhas, some want the long only in addressing from a distance, but it should not be taken in addressing from near, because of the seeing. ‘I am.’ The Buddhas protect me.

original: Kamme dutiyā
analyzed: kamme dutiyā
translated: In the second case in a verb.

original: Kattukriyābhisambandhaṃ kārakaṃ kammamuccate;
analyzed: kattu kriyā abhisambandham kārakam kammam uccate
translated: The case that is related to the action by means of the doing is called the object.

original: Nibbatti vikatippatti bhedā taṃ tividhaṃ bhave.
analyzed: nibbatti bhedāḥ tam tividham bhave
translated: It is of three kinds, as origination, transformation, and attainment.

original: Asmiṃ dutiyā vibhattihoti-aṃyo iti dutiyā-aṃ-buddhaṃpaṇamāmi, yossaṭe-buddhe.
analyzed: asmin dutiyā iti dutiyā am buddham paṇamāmi
translated: The second case is expressed by the endings -aṃ, -o, -i, -e.

original: Kattukaraṇesu tatiyā.
analyzed: kattu karaṇesu tatiyā
translated: The third case is expressed by the endings -e, -e, -e, -e.

original: Kriyaṃ yo kurute mukhyo sa kattā yojito na vā karaṇaṃ taṃ visesena yaṃ kriyāsiddhihetukaṃ.
analyzed: kriyam yaḥ kurute mukhyaḥ sa kattā yojitaḥ na vā karaṇam tam visesena yam kriyā siddhi hetukam
translated: The principal agent is the doer of the action, whether he is related to it or not. The instrument is that by means of which the action is done.

original: Tesu kārakesu tatiyā vibhatti hoti-nābhi iti tatiyā-nā-nāssā’ti vattate.🔽Atena🔽Akārantato nāmasmā parassa nāvacanassa enādeso hoti-buddhena desito dhammo-hi-🔽Suhisvasesa.🔽Akārantassa suhīsvehoti-buddhehi-ve’ti vattate.🔽Smāhisminnaṃ mhābhīmhi.🔽Nāmasmā paresaṃ smāhisminnaṃ mhābhīmhi vā honti yathākkamaṃ-hissa bhiyādeso-buddhebhī, karaṇe-buddhena loko sucarati, buddhehi, buddhehi, vā.
analyzed: tesu kārakesu tatiyā vibhatti hoti nābhi iti vattate  a tena  akāra antataḥ nāmasmā parassa nā vacanassa ena ādesaḥ hoti buddhena desitaḥ  su hi svase sa  a kāra antassa vattate  sma ahi sminnam mha abhi mhi  paresam vā honti buddhehi buddhehi vā
translated: The third case is expressed by the endings -e, -e, -e, -e.🔽The fourth case is expressed by the endings -e, -e, -e, -e.🔽The fifth case is expressed by the endings -assa, -assa, -assa, -assa.

original: Catutthī sampadāne.
analyzed: catutthī sampadāne
translated: The sixth case is expressed by the endings -assa, -assa, -assa, -assa.🔽The seventh case is expressed by the endings -e, -e, -e, -e.

original: Anumantvanirākattujjhesakānaṃ vasā tadhā;🔽Dadāti kammanā yuttaṃ sampadānamudiritaṃ.
analyzed: vasā tadhā  dadāti kammanā yuttam sampadānam udiritam
translated: The power of the one who consents, the one who objects, the one who urges, is likewise;🔽It is said to be the completion of the act, when it is given to one who is fit.

original: Tasmiṃ sampadānakārake catutthi siyā-sanaṃ iti catutthī-sa.🔽Suñsassa.🔽Nāmasmā parassa sassa suñhoti-saca-chaṭṭhiyā’tivattamāne
analyzed: tasmin sampadāna kārake iti  suñ sassa  nāmasmā parassa sassa suñha uti saca cha ṭṭhiyā ativattamāne
translated: The fourth case is used in the same way for the words anumantvā, nirākatvā, ujjhāpetvā, vasitvā, and dadāti.

original: Ñakānubandhādyantā.🔽Chaṭṭhīniddiṭāṭhassa ñānubandhakānubandhādyantā hontī’tiādibhuto hoti-ukāro uccāraṇattho-ñākāro ettheva saṅketattho-buddhassa pupphaṃ dehi.-Ato vā bahulamitica vattate.
analyzed: ñaka anubandha ādi antā  chaṭṭhī niddiṭa aṭhassa ña anubandhaka anubandha ādi antāḥ honti iti ādi bhutaḥ hoti ukāro uccāraṇa tthaḥ ña ākāraḥ ettha iva saṅketa atthaḥ buddhassa puppham vā bahulam iti ca vattate
translated: The fourth case is called the sampadāna-case.

original: Sassāya catutthiyā🔽Akārantato parassa sassa catutthiyā āyo hoti vā bahulaṃ-buddhāya, yebhuyyena tādatthe yevāyamāyo dissatī’ti itoparaṃ nodāharīyate-naṃ-dīgho’tivattate.🔽Sunaṃhisu🔽Esu nāmassa dīgho hoti-buddhānaṃ.
analyzed: sassāya catutthiyā  akāra antataḥ parassa sassa catutthiyā āyaḥ hoti vā bahulaṃbuddhāya yebhuyyena tādatthe yā iva ayam āyaḥ dissati iti itas param  sunaṃhisu  esu nāmassa dīghaḥ hoti buddhānam
translated: The fifth case is called the sassa-case.

original: Pañcamyavadhismā.
analyzed: pañcamī avadhi smā
translated: The fifth case is used after a noun in the sense of ‘for the sake of’.

original: Sīmābhuto padatthānaṃ yo calo niccalo’tha vā;
analyzed: pada tthānam yaḥ calaḥ niccalo atha vā

original: Accuto pubbakā rūpā namāhuravadhimbudhā.
analyzed: accutas pubbakāḥ rūpāḥ nam āhuḥ avadhim budhā
translated: The forms of the past are not cut off, they are called the source of the world.🔽The fifth case is formed by the endings -smā, -hī, -smā, -ato, -yonaṃ, -ṭāṭe, -ve, -te.

original: Etasmā kārakā pañcamīvibhatti hoti-smā hī iti pañcamī-smā-ato yonaṃ ṭāṭe veti dva vatta te.🔽Smāsmintaṃ.
analyzed: kārakā pañcamī vibhatti hoti smā hī iti pañcamī smā a taḥ ṭā ṭe vā iti dva te  sma asmin tam
translated: The fifth case is formed by the endings -smā, -smin.

original: Akārantato nāmasmā paresaṃ smāsminnaṃ ṭāṭe vā honti yathākkamaṃ.🔽Buddhā pahā niccharati. Buddhamhā, buddhasmāvā-hi-buddhehi, buddhebhi.🔽Chaṭṭhi sambandhe🔽Kriyākārakasañjāto assedamhāvahetuko;🔽Sambandho’ti pavutto so sambandhidvayanissito.
analyzed: akāra antataḥ sma asminnam ṭāṭe vā honti yathākkamam  buddhā pahā niccharati buddhamhā  chaṭṭhi sambandhe  kriyā kāraka sañjātaḥ  sambandhaḥ ti pavuttaḥ saḥ sambandhi dvaya nissito
translated: The fifth case is formed by the endings -smā, -smin after a noun ending in a vowel.

original: Sambandhittāvisesepi chaṭṭhī hedakato siyā;🔽Tato hi jātā sambandhaṃ vadeyya na panaññato.🔽Sambandhe chaṭṭhi vibhatti hoti-sa naṃ iti chaṭṭhi-sa-buddhassa vihāro-naṃ-buddhānaṃ.🔽Sattamyādhāre.🔽Kiriyā kattukammaṭṭhā ādhārīyati yena so;🔽Ādhāro catudhā vutto vyāpakādippabhedato.🔽Ādhārakārake sattamī vibhatti hoti-

original: Smiṃ su iti sattamī-smiṃ-buddhe pasanno-buddhamhi, buddhasmiṃ, vā-su buddhesu.
analyzed: smim su iti sattamīsmiṃbuddhe pasannobuddhamhi buddhasmim buddhesu
translated: In this, in this way, the seventh case: being pleased with the Buddha, in the Buddha, in the Buddhas.

original: Buddho sabbatthadāyī bhavati hi bhajataṃ buddha buddhaṃ na taṃ kiṃ dinnaṃ buddhena
analyzed: buddhaḥ sabbattha dāyī bhavati hi bhajatam buddha buddham na tam kim dinnam buddhena
translated: The Buddha, the bestower of all that is good, is indeed the Buddha for those who serve the Buddha. What is given by the Buddha is not the same.

original: loke sivapadamapi te yanti buddhena yasmā asmā buddhassa pītiṃ parahitavidhayaṃdeti
analyzed: loke siva padam api te yanti buddhena yasmai asmai buddhassa pītim para hita vidhayaṃdeti
translated: Because of the Buddha, they go to the auspicious state in the world. Therefore, the one who delights in the Buddha, who is intent on the welfare of others,

original: buddhānapeto mañño buddhassa niccaṃ ghaṭayati matimā konu bhattiṃ na buddhe.
analyzed: buddha an apetaḥ maññaḥ buddhassa niccam ghaṭayati matimā ko nu bhattim na buddhe
translated: the wise one, having gone to the Buddha, always applies his mind to the Buddha. He does not serve the Buddha elsewhere.

original: Evamaññeyampi ghaṭapaṭādīnamakārantānaṃ pulliṅgānaṃ rūpanayo kriyābhisambandho ca-visesanampana
analyzed: evam aññeyam pi ghaṭa paṭa ādīnam akāra antānam pulliṅgānam rūpa nayo kriyā abhisambandhaḥ
translated: In this way, we will also explain the method of declension and the connection with verbs of nouns ending in vowels, such as ghaṭa, paṭa, etc., which are neuter.

original: vakkhāma-ito paraṃ chaṭṭhiyā catutthīsamattā pañcamībahuvacanassa ca tatiyāsamattā
analyzed: param chaṭṭhiyā catutthī samattā pañcamī bahuvacanassa ca tatiyā samattā
translated: From here on, the sixth case is equal to the fourth, and the fifth plural is equal to the third.

original: na tā dassīyante-gumbasi-ato sissāti ca vattate.
analyzed: na tā sissāti ca vattate
translated: They are not shown: in the anthill, from that, a student.

original: Kvace vā.
analyzed: kva ce vā
translated: Or in some places.

original: Akārantato nāmasmā parassa sissa e hoti vā kvacī-gumbe, gumbo-sesaṃ buddhasamaṃ-evaṃ vattabbe, vattabbo iccādi.
analyzed: akāra antataḥ nāmasmā parassa si ssa e hoti vā buddha samam evam vattabbe iccādi
translated: After a noun ending in a vowel, sissa becomes e or hoti in some places: in the anthill, the anthill. The rest is equal to the Buddha. In this way, it should be said. It should be said, etc.

original: Yossa ṭe’ti ca vattate.
analyzed: y oḥ saḥ ṭa iti ca vattate
translated: Yossa ṭe is also said.

original: Ekaccādīhato.🔽Akārantehi ekaccādīhi yonaṃ ṭe hoti-ekacce,(bho)ekacce, ekacce-evaṃ paṭhamasaddassa-nāssa sā ve’ti ca vattate.🔽Kodhādīhi.🔽Ehi nāssa sā hoti vā-kodhasā, kodhena, atthasā, attheneccādi-veti vattate.🔽Manādīhi smiṃsannāsmānaṃ sisoosāsā.
analyzed: ekacca ādi hataḥ  akāra antehi ekacca ādīhi yaḥ nam ṭe hoti ekacce bho ekacce ekacce evam paṭhama saddassanā assa sā vā iti ca vattate  kodha ādīhi  ehi na assa sā hoti vā a kodhasā kodhena atthasā atthena iccā divā iti vattate  sisoosāsā
translated: With some, from anger.

original: Manādīhi smamādinaṃ sisomasāsā honti vā yathākkamaṃ-mano, manaṃ-manasā, manena-manaso, manassa-manasā, manā, manamhā, manasmā-manasi, mane, manamhi, manasmiṃ.🔽Tama tapa teja ura sirappabhutayo manādayo.🔽Gacchantasi-sissa ve’ti ca vattate-parato bhiyyo nānu vattayissāma vuttiyāyevānuvuttassagamyamānattā.🔽Ntassaṃ.🔽Simhi ntappaccayassa aṃ hoti vā-“gasīna”nti silope-gacchaṃ-aññatra-gacchanto.🔽Ntantunaṃ nto yomhi paṭhame.

original: Bhudhātuto ntassa aṃ hoti simhi niccampunabbidhānā-bhavaṃ.
analyzed: bhu dhātutaḥ ntassa am hoti simhi niccam punar bidhāna ābhavam
translated: In the case of the word “bhante” (Sir), the aṃ is changed to aṃ, and the i to e, by the rules of sandhi.

original: Bhavato vā bhonto gayonāse.
analyzed: bhavataḥ vā bhontaḥ gayonāse
translated: Or the bhavaṃ (Sir) is changed to bhonto (gentlemen) by the rules of sandhi.

original: Bhavantasaddassa bhontādeso vā hoti gayonāse-bhonto, bhontā, bhavanto, bhavantā-evamālapanepi-ge🔽pana-(bho) bhonta, bhontā, bhava, bhavā, bhavaṃ-bhavaṃ, bhavantaṃ, bhonte, bhavante-bhotā,
analyzed: bhavanta saddassa bhonta ādesaḥ vā hoti bhontaḥ bhavantaḥ bhavantaḥ  panabho bhonta bhontā bhava bhava bhavaṃbhavam bhavantam bhonte bhavantebhotā
translated: Or the word bhonto (gentlemen) is changed to bhontā (ladies), bhonto (gentlemen), bhavanto (gentlemen), bhavantā (ladies) by the rules of sandhi.🔽In the case of addressing, the word bhante (Sir) is changed to (bho) bhonta (Sir), bhontā (ladies), bhava (gentleman), bhavā (gentlemen), bhavaṃ (Sir).🔽The word bhavaṃ (Sir) is changed to bhavaṃ (Sir), bhavantaṃ (Sir), bhonte (gentlemen), bhavante (gentlemen).🔽The word bhavaṃ (Sir) is changed to bhotā (by Sir), bhontena (by Sir), bhavatā (by you), bhavantena (by you).

original: bhontena, bhavatā, bhavantena-bhoto, bhontassa, bhavato, bhavassa, bhavantassa.🔽Satosabbhe.
analyzed: bhontena bhavatā bhavantena bhotaḥ bhontassa bhavataḥ bhavassa bhavantassa  satas sap bhe
translated: The word bhavaṃ (Sir) is changed to bhoto (of Sir), bhontassa (of Sir), bhavato (of you), bhavassa (of you), bhavantassa (of you).

original: Santasaddassa sabbhavati bhakāre-sabbhi.🔽Mahantārahantānaṃ vā ṭā
analyzed: santa saddassa sap bhavati bhakāre sap bhi  mahantāra hantānam vā ṭā
translated: In the case of the word “sabbe” (all), the sa is changed to sa by the rules of sandhi.🔽The word sabbe (all) is changed to sabbehi (by all).🔽Or the word mahā (great) and arahā (worthy) is changed to mahā (great) and arahā (worthy) by the rules of sandhi.

original: Simhi mahantārahantānaṃ natassa ṭā vā hoti-mahā, mahaṃ, mahanto-arahā, arahaṃ, arahanto-bhavantādīnaṃ sesaṃ gacchantasamaṃ-asmasi.🔽Rājādiyuvāditvā.
analyzed: simhi mahanta arahantānam na tassa ṭā vā hoti mahā maham mahantaḥ arahāḥ araham arahantaḥ bhavanta ādīnam sesam gacchanta samam asmasi  rāja ādi yuva ādi tvā
translated: In the case of the word “asmā” (from us), the s is changed to s by the rules of sandhi.🔽In the case of the words rājā (king) and yuvā (young), the s is changed to s by the rules of sandhi.

original: Rājādihi yuvādīhi ca parassa sissa ā hoti-asmā.
analyzed: rāja ādihi yuva ādīhi ca parassa sissa ā hoti asmai
translated: The word asmā (from us) is changed to asmā (from us).

original: Yonamāno.
analyzed: yonamānaḥ
translated: In the case of the word “yonamāno” (thinking of you), the o is changed to o by the rules of sandhi.

original: Rājādīhi yuvādīhi ca yonamāno vā hoti-asmāno, asmā-(bho)asma, asmā, asmāno, asmā.🔽Vāmhā naṅa.🔽Rājādinaṃ yuvādanaṃ cānaṅhoti vāmhi-asmānaṃ, asmiṃ, asmāno, asme.
analyzed: rāja ādīhi yuva ādīhi ca vā asmai asmānaḥ  vām hā naṅa  rāja adinam yuva adanam ca anaṅhaḥ uti asmin asme
translated: The genitive of rājā, yuvā, etc., is yuvā, etc., with the addition of -o, -a, -m, -e, -e, -e, -o, -e.🔽The locative is yuvā, etc., with the addition of -hi, -naṃ.🔽The genitive of rājā, etc., and yuvā, etc., is yuvā, etc., with the addition of -ssa, -smin, -o, -me.

original: Nāsseno🔽Kammādito nāvacanassa eno vā hoti-asmena, asmanā.
analyzed: nāsseno  kamma ādeḥ na a va canassa enaḥ vā hoti asmena asmanā
translated: The ablative is yuvā, etc., with the addition of -ssena.

original: Kammādito.
analyzed: kamma āditaḥ
translated: The instrumental of kammā, etc., is kammā, etc., with the addition of -ena, -nā.🔽The ablative of kammā, etc., is kammā, etc., with the addition of -to.

original: Kammādito smino ni hoti vā-asmani, asme, asmamhi, asmasmiṃ-sesaṃ buddhasaddasamaṃ-muddha
analyzed: kamma āditaḥ sminaḥ ni hoti vā asmani asme asmamhi asmasmin sesam
translated: The locative of kammā, etc., is kammā, etc., with the addition of -ni, -me, -hi, -smin. The rest is the same as in the word buddha.

original: gāṇḍīvadhatva anima laghimādayo asmāsamā-evaṃ rājā kāladdhānavācī addhāca paṭhamādutiyāsu
analyzed: rājā paṭhamā dutiyāsu
translated: The dative and ablative of gāṇḍīva, dhatva, anima, laghimā, etc., are the same as those of rājā.

original: attātu māno tatiyāsattamyekavacanesuca.
analyzed: attā tu māno tatiyā sattamī ekavacanesu ca
translated: The genitive of kāla, dhana, vācī, addhā, paṭhama, dutiya, attā, māna, is kālassa, dhanassa, vācassā, addhassa, paṭhamassa, dutiyassa, attano, manassa.

original: Rājassi nāmhi.
analyzed: rājassi nāmhi
translated: The locative of rājā is rājasi.

original: Rājassi vā hoti nāmhi-rājinā-aññatra-🔽Nāsmāsuraññā.
analyzed: rājassi vā hoti  na asmā suraññā
translated: The locative of rājā is rājasi, or rājā is rājinaṃ.

original: Nāsmāsu rājassa savibhattissa raññā hoti-raññā.🔽Sunaṃ hisū.🔽Rājassa ū hoti vā sunaṃhisu-rājūbhi, rājehi, rājūbhi, rājebhi.
analyzed: na asmāsu rājassa sa vibhattissa raññā hoti raññā  sunam hisū  rājassa u hoti vā rājehi rājūbhi rājebhi
translated: The locative of rājā is not rājassa.🔽The locative of rājā with a case-ending is rājassa.🔽The genitive of rājā is rājuno.

original: Rañño raññassa rājino se.
analyzed: raññaḥ raññassa rājinaḥ se
translated: The genitive of rājā is rājassa, rājino.

original: Se rājassa savibhattissa ete ādesā honti-rañño raññassa, rājino, rājūnaṃ.
analyzed: se rājassa sa vibhattissa ete ādesāḥ honti raññaḥ raññassa rājinaḥ rājūnam
translated: The forms of the King with the case-endings are: rañño, raññassa, rājino, rājūnaṃ.

original: Rājassa raññaṃ.
analyzed: rājassa raññam
translated: Rājassa, raññaṃ.🔽Raññaṃ is not the form of rañño with the case-endings. Raññaṃ, rājānaṃ.

original: Smimhi raññerājini.
analyzed: smimhi raññeḥ rājini
translated: Raññerājini.

original: Smimhi rājassa savibhattissa raññerājinī honti-raññe, rājini, rājusu, rājesu “samāse
analyzed: smimhi rājassa sa vibhattissa raññe rājinī honti raññe rājini rājusu rājesu samāse
translated: Raññā, rājini, rājusu, rājesu.🔽Vā is the form of rañño with the case-endings that was stated in the compound.

original: vā”ti rājassa nāsasmāsmiṃsu yaṃ vuttaṃ taṃ vā hoti-yathā-kāsiraññā, kāsirājena =
analyzed: vāti rājassa yam vuttam tam vā hoti yathā kāsiraññā kāsirājena
translated: As follows: kāsiraññā, kāsirājena = kāsirañño, kāsiraññassa, kāsirājino, kāsirājassa.🔽Kāsiraññā, kāsirājā, kāsirājamhā, kāsirājasmā.

original: kāsirañño, kāsiraññassa, kāsirājino, kāsirājassa-kāsiraññā, kāsirājā, kāsirājamhā,
analyzed: kāsiraññaḥ kāsiraññassa kāsirājino kāsirājassa kāsiraññā kāsirājā kāsirājamhā
translated: Kāsiraññe, kāsirājini, kāsirāje, kāsirājamhi, kāsirājasmiṃ.🔽Addhato is not the form of rañño with the case-endings.🔽The forms of the King with the case-endings are: rañño, raññassa, rājino, rājūnaṃ.🔽Rājassa, raññaṃ.🔽Raññaṃ is not the form of rañño with the case-endings. Raññaṃ, rājānaṃ.🔽Raññā.🔽Raññerājini.

original: kāsirājasmā-kāsiraññe, kāsirājini, kāsirāje, kāsirājamhi, kāsirājasmiṃ-addhato nāmhi.
analyzed: kāsirājasmākāsiraññe kāsirājini kāsirāje kāsirājamhi kāsirājasmiṃaddhataḥ nāmhi
translated: Raññā, rājini, rājusu, rājesu.🔽Vā is the form of rañño with the case-endings that was stated in the compound.🔽As follows: kāsiraññā, kāsirājena = kāsirañño, kāsiraññassa, kāsirājino, kāsirājassa.🔽Kāsiraññā, kāsirājā, kāsirājamhā, kāsirājasmā.

original: Pumakammathāmaddhānaṃ vā sasmāsuca pumādinamuhoti vā sasamāsunāmhi ceti utte-addhunā-aññatra kammādittā vā ene-addhena-addhanā-se ukāre ca.
analyzed: vā vā ukāre ca
translated: Kāsiraññe, kāsirājini, kāsirāje, kāsirājamhi, kāsirājasmiṃ.

original: Iyuvaṇṇājjhalā nāmassaneka.
analyzed: iyu vaṇ ṇa a c ha lāḥ nāmas san eka
translated: Addhato is not the form of rañño with the case-endings.

original: Nāmassante vattamānā ivaṇṇuvaṇṇājhalasaññā honti yathākkamaṃ.🔽Jhalā sassa no.🔽Jhalato sassa no vā hoti-addhuno, addhussa, addhassa.🔽Nā smāssa
analyzed: vattamānāḥ i vaṇṇu vaṇṇā jha l saññāḥ honti yathākkamam  jha lā sassa naḥ  jha l ataḥ sassa naḥ vā hoti addhunaḥ addhussa addhassa  na sma āssa
translated: The forms of the words ending in -a are as if they were the forms of the words ending in -u.🔽The forms of the words ending in -u are as if they were the forms of the words ending in -a.🔽The forms of the words ending in -a are as if they were the forms of the words ending in -o.🔽The forms of the words ending in -o are as if they were the forms of the words ending in -a.

analyzed: aghonam ge vā rassaḥ hoti suvā

original: Ākārantaṃ.🔽Muni.🔽Yosujjhissa pume.
analyzed: ākāra antam 🔽muni 🔽yosujjhissa pume
translated: The ending

original: Jhasaññassa issa yosu vā ṭa hoti pulliṅge-munayo-ato’ti sāmaññaniddesā ato yonaṃ ṭāṭe sampattāpi avidhāna sāmatthiyā na honti-aññatra-
analyzed: jha saññassa i ssa yosu vā ṭa hoti sāmañña niddesāḥ atas y onam ṭa ā ṭe sampattā api a vidhāna sāmatthiyāḥ na honti aññatra
translated: In the case of the word jhasa, the feminine is formed by adding yosu or ṭa to the masculine. The rule is stated thus: “The feminine is formed by adding yosu or ṭa to the masculine.” But the feminine is not formed by adding ṭa to the masculine in the case of the words beginning with yona, because the rule is stated thus: “Except the words beginning with yona.”

original: Lopo.🔽Jhalato yonaṃ lopo hotī’ti yo lope.
analyzed: lopaḥ  jha lataḥ lopaḥ iti yaḥ lope
translated: In the declensions of the words munayo, munī, munīnaṃ, muninā, munīhi, munībhi, munīsu, the long vowels are not lengthened, because of the general rule, and because of the particular rule.

original: Yolopanisu dīgho.
analyzed: yaḥ lopa nisu dīghaḥ
translated: The elision of the final syllable.

original: Yonaṃ lopo nisu ca dīgho hoti-munī-(bho)munī, munayo, munī-muniṃ munayo munī = muninā🔽munīhi munībhi-yolopa nīsu vī mantuvantunamiccādi ñāpakā ikārā kārānaṃ “sunaṃhisūti”dīgha
analyzed: yonam lopaḥ nisu ca dīghaḥ hoti munī bhomunī munayaḥ munīmunim munayaḥ munī munī  munīhi munībhiyolopa nīsu vī mantu vantu nam iti ādi ñāpakāḥ i kārā kāra anam sunam hi sūti dīgha
translated: The elision of the final syllable of the words munayo, munī, munīnaṃ, muninā, munīhi, munībhi, munīsu, is optional.🔽The lengthening of the penultimate syllable.

original: ssāniccattā munihaccādīpi hoti-munino, munissa munīnaṃ, muninā munimhāmunismā, munimhi🔽munismiṃ munīsu-evaṃ kavikapigiri ādayo-aggiisīnaṃ ayaṃ vaseso.
analyzed: hoti muninaḥ munissa munīnam muninā munimhā munismā munimhi  munismim ayam vasesaḥ
translated: The lengthening of the penultimate syllable of the words munayo, munī, munīnaṃ, muninā, munīhi, munībhi, munīsu, is optional.

original: Sassāggi to ni.
analyzed: sassa aggi taḥ ni
translated: The lengthening of the final syllable.🔽The lengthening of the final syllable of the words munayo, munī, munīnaṃ, muninā, munīhi, munībhi, munīsu, is optional.🔽The lengthening of the final syllable of the words munino, munissa, munīnaṃ, muninā, munimhā, munismā, munimhi, munismiṃ, munīsu, is optional.🔽The lengthening of the final syllable of the words kavikapigiri, etc., is optional.

original: Aggismā sissa ni hoti vā-aggini. Aggi, aggayo, aggī.🔽Ṭe sissisismā.
analyzed: aggismā sissa ni hoti vāaggini aggi aggayaḥ aggī  ṭe sissisismā
translated: The elision of the final syllable of the words agga, aggaṃ, aggī, aggissa, aggismā, is optional.🔽The elision of the final syllable of the words agga, aggaṃ, aggī, aggissa, aggismā, is optional.

original: Isismā sissa ṭe vā hoti-ise, isi-brahmādittā gasse vā-(bho)ise isi isī.🔽Dutiyassa yossa.
analyzed: isi smā ṭe vā hoti ise isi brahmā dittā gasse vā abhoise isi isī 🔽dutiyassa yossa
translated: The elision of the final syllable of the words isi, isī, isīnaṃ, isinā, isīhi, isībhi, isīsu, isissa, isissaṃ, isīnaṃ, isinā, isīhi, isībhi, isīsu, isissa, isissaṃ, isīnaṃ, isinā, isīhi, isībhi, isīsu, isino, isissa, isīnaṃ, isinā, isīhi, isībhi, isīsu, isīhi, isībhi, isīsu, isīnaṃ, isinā, isīhi, isībhi, isīsu, isīnaṃ, isinā, isīhi, isībhi, isīsu, isīnaṃ, isinā, isīhi, isībhi, isī

original: Isasmā parassa dutiyā yossa ṭe vā hoti-ise, isayo, isi, sesaṃmunisaddasamaṃ-ādisaddano smimhi-ratyādihi ṭo smino.
analyzed: isasmā parassa dutiyā yossa ṭe vā hoti ise isayoḥ isi se sam muni sadda samam ādi saddanaḥ smi mhi rati ādi hi ṭaḥ smino
translated: Isayo, isi, sesaṃ muni-saddasamaṃ.

original: Ratyādīhi smino ṭo hoti vā-ādo, ādimhi, ādismiṃ. Samāse ikārantato yosmiṃsu viseso.
analyzed: rati ādīhi sminaḥ ṭaḥ hoti ādimhi ādismin samāse ikāra antataḥ visesaḥ
translated: Ratyādīhi smino ṭo hoti vā-ādo, ādimhi, ādismiṃ. In a compound, the following distinction applies to the words ending in ika.

original: Itoññatthe pume.
analyzed: i taḥ ña tthe pume
translated: Itoññatthe pume.

original: Aññapadatthe vattamānā ikārantato nāmasmā yonaṃ no ne vā honti yathākkamaṃ pulliṅge-ariyavuttino, ariyavuttayo, ariyavutti-evamālapane-ariyavuttine, ariyavuttayo ariyavuttī.
analyzed: añña pada atthe vattamānāḥ ikāra antataḥ nāmasmai ya ūnam naḥ ne vā honti yathākkamam pulliṅge ariya vuttinaḥ ariya vuttayaḥ ariya vutti evam ālapane ariya vuttine ariya vuttayaḥ ariya vuttī
translated: In the sense of “other than this,” the words ending in ika have no or ne in the masculine, in the locative case, respectively-ariyavuttino, ariyavuttayo, ariyavutti. In the same way in ālapane-ariyavuttine, ariyavuttayo, ariyavuttī.

original: Ne smino kvaci.
analyzed: ne sminaḥ kvaci
translated: Ne smino kvaci.

original: Aññapadatthe vattamānā ikārantato nāmasmā smino ne hoti vā kvaci-ariyavuttine, ariyavuttimhi, ariyavuttismiṃ, “kvacī“ti vuttattā yathādassanaṃ na sabbatta ne ādeso.
analyzed: añña pada tthe vattamānāḥ ikāra antataḥ nāmasmā sminaḥ ne hoti vā kvaci ariyavuttine ariyavuttimhi ariyavuttismim kvaci iti vutta ttā yathādassanam na ne ādesaḥ
translated: In the sense of “other than,” the words ending in ika have ne or smin in the locative case, respectively, in some instances-ariyavuttine, ariyavuttimhi, ariyavuttismiṃ. Because “kvaci” is said, the elision of ne is not in all instances, but according to the view of the grammarians.

original: Ikārantaṃ.
analyzed: ikāra antam
translated: The words ending in ika.

original: Daddhī, silopo, anapuṃsakattā na rasso.
analyzed: daddhī si lopaḥ a napuṃsaka ttā na rassaḥ
translated: Daddhī, silopo, because it is not neuter, it is not rassa.

original: Yonaṃ none pume.
analyzed: yonam na ūne pume
translated: Yonaṃ none pume.

original: Jhasaññito yonaṃ nonevāhonti yathākkamaṃ pulliṅge. Daddhino.
analyzed: jha saññitaḥ yonam yathākkamam pul liṅge daddhinaḥ
translated: The words ending in ika have no or ne in the locative case, respectively, in the masculine, according to the view of the grammarians. Daddhino.

original: Jantuhetvīghapehi vā.
analyzed: vā
translated: Or by the causes of creatures and by the particles of the neuter.

original: Jantuhetuhi īkārantehi ghapasaññehi ca paresaṃ yonaṃ vā lopo hoti-daddhī, daddhiyo-evamālapane-getu-daddhi, daddhī.
analyzed: jantu hetuhi īkāra antehi ghapa saññehi ca paresam vā lopaḥ
translated: By the causes of creatures and by the particles of the neuter ending in ī, there is optionally elision of the yona: daddhī, daddhiyo; thus in the case of the word ālapana: getu-daddhī, daddhī.

original: Na jhīko.
analyzed: na jhīko
translated: Not in jhīka.

original: Jhasaññito aṃvacanassa naṃ vā hoti-daṇḍinaṃ, daṇḍiṃ, daṇḍine.
analyzed: jha saññitaḥ a ṃ vacanassa nam vā hoti daṇḍinam daṇḍim daṇḍine
translated: After the word jhasaññita, naṃ becomes na or naṃ: daṇḍinaṃ, daṇḍiṃ, daṇḍine.

original: No.
analyzed: no
translated: Not.

original: Jhito yonaṃ no vā hoti pulliṅgehi dutiyā yossa no daṇḍino, daṇḍi, daṇḍinā, daṇḍīhi, daṇḍībhi-daṇḍino, daṇḍissa, daṇḍinaṃ-daṇḍinā, daṇḍimhā, daṇḍismā.
analyzed: jhitaḥ no vā hoti pulliṅgehi dutiyā yossa no daṇḍinaḥ daṇḍi daṇḍinā daṇḍīhi daṇḍībhi daṇḍinaḥ daṇḍissa daṇḍinaṃ daṇḍinā daṇḍimhā daṇḍismā
translated: After jhito, the yona does not become na: daṇḍino, daṇḍi, daṇḍinā, daṇḍīhi, daṇḍībhi; daṇḍino, daṇḍissa, daṇḍinaṃ; daṇḍinā, daṇḍimhā, daṇḍismā.

original: Smino ni.
analyzed: sminaḥ ni
translated: In smiṃ, ni.

original: Jhito smiṃvacanassa ni hoti vā-daṇḍini. Daṇḍimhi, daṇḍismiṃ, daṇḍīsuevaṃ saṅghi gaṇi gāmaṇippabhutayo.
analyzed: jh itaḥ smiṃvacanassa ni hoti vā daṇḍini daṇḍimhi daṇḍismim daṇḍīsu evam saṅghi gaṇi gāmaṇi pabhutayaḥ
translated: After jhito, smiṃvacanassa ni becomes ni or optionally: daṇḍini, daṇḍimhi, daṇḍismiṃ, daṇḍīsuevaṃ saṅghi, gaṇi, gāmaṇi, pabhutayo.

original: Īkārantaṃ.
analyzed: īkāra antam
translated: The neuter ending in ī.

original: Bhikkhu.🔽Lā yonaṃ vo pume.
analyzed: bhikkhu  lā yonam vaḥ pume
translated: Bhikkhu.

original: Lato yonaṃ vo hoti vā pulliṅge.
analyzed: lataḥ vaḥ hoti vā pul liṅge
translated: Lā after the yona, vo after the masculine.🔽After the neuter ending in la, vo becomes optionally after the masculine.

original: Vevosu lussa
analyzed: ve vosu lussa
translated: Vevosu lussa

original: Lasaññassa ussa vevosu ṭa hoti-bhikkhavo-aññatra-yo lope dīgho-bhikkhu (bho)bhikkhu.
analyzed: la saññassa ussa ve vosu ṭa hoti bhikkha vo añña trayaḥ lope dīghaḥ bhikkhu bho bhikkhu
translated: After the word lasaññita, ussa becomes vevosu and ṭa: bhikkhavo; except: yo lope dīgho: bhikkhu (bho) bhikkhu.

original: Pumālapane vevo.
analyzed: pumān ālapane vevaḥ
translated: Vevosu after the masculine ending in ālapana.

original: Lasaññato uto yossālapane vevo honti vā pulliṅge-bhikkhave, bhikkhavo, bhikkhu-bhikkhuṃ,
analyzed: la sañña taḥ u taḥ yossa ālapane ve vaḥ honti vā pulliṅge bhikkhave bhikkhavaḥ bhikkhu bhikkhum
translated: In the case of the words lasaññato, uto, yo, ssā, lapane, vevo, honti, vā, pulliṅge, bhikkhave, bhikkhavo, bhikkhu-bhikkhuṃ,

original: bhikkhavo, bhikkhu-bhikkhunā, bhikkhuhi,bhikkhūbhi-bhikkhuno, bhikkhussa, bhikkhūnaṃ-bhikkhunā,
analyzed: bhikkhavaḥ bhikkhu bhikkhunā bhikkhuhi bhikkhūbhi bhikkhunaḥ bhikkhussa bhikkhūnaṃ bhikkhunā
translated: bhikkhavo, bhikkhu-bhikkhunā, bhikkhuhi, bhikkhūbhi-bhikkhuno, bhikkhussa, bhikkhūnaṃ-bhikkhunā,

original: bhikkhumhā. Bhikkhusmā-bhikkhumhi. Bhikkhusmiṃ, bhikkhūsu-evaṃ setu ketu bhānu ādayo-jantuhetūnaṃ
analyzed: bhikkhumhā bhikkhusmā abhikkhumhi bhikkhusmin bhikkhūsu evam setu ketu bhānu
translated: bhikkhumhā. Bhikkhusmā-bhikkhumhi. Bhikkhusmiṃ, bhikkhūsu-In the same way, setu, ketu, bhānu, ādayaṃ-jantu, hetu,

original: yosvayamhedo-jantvādinā vā yossa lope-jantu.
analyzed: vā yoḥ sa lopa ijantu
translated: yosvayamhedo-jantvādinā vā yossa lope-jantu.

original: Cantvādito no ca.
analyzed: cantu ā t itaḥ naḥ ca
translated: Cantvādito no ca.

original: Jantvādito yonaṃ no hoti vo ca vā pulliṅge-jantuno, jantavo, jantuyo-evaṃ dutiyāyomhi-(bho)
analyzed: jantu āditaḥ no ca vā pulliṅge jantunaḥ jantavaḥ
translated: Jantvādito yonaṃ no hoti vo ca vā pulliṅge-jantuno, jantavo, jantuyo-In the same way, dutiyāyomhi-(bho)

original: jantu, jantu, jantuno jantavo-“pumālapane vevo”tivā ve vo ca jantave, jantavo, jantuyo-hetu,
analyzed: jantu jantu jantunaḥ jantavaḥ upumālapane vevā utivā ve vaḥ ca jantave jantavaḥ
translated: jantu, jantu, jantuno jantavo-“pumālapane vevo”tivā ve vo ca jantave, jantavo, jantuyo-hetu,

original: hetavo, hetu. Hetuyo-“yomhivā kvacī“tī yosulasaññassa ussa vā ṭā deso hetayo, hetuyo-(bho)hetu,
analyzed: hetavaḥ hetu hetu yo yo mhi vā kvaci iti yosu la saññassa ussa vā desaḥ hetayaḥ hetu yo bho hetu
translated: hetavo, hetu. Hetuyo-“yomhivā kvacī”tī yosulasaññassa ussa vā ṭā deso hetayo, hetuyo-(bho)hetu,

original: hetu, hetave, hetavo, hetayo, hetuyo-hetuṃ, hetu, hetavo, hetayo, hetuyo bahusaddā namhi.
analyzed: hetu hetave hetavaḥ hetayaḥ hetuyaḥ hetum hetu hetavaḥ hetayaḥ hetuyaḥ bahu saddāḥ namhi
translated: Hetave, hetavo, hetayo, hetuyo-hetuṃ, hetu, hetavo, hetayo, hetuyo.

original: Bahukatinnaṃ
analyzed: bahuka tinnam
translated: Of many🔽Namhi is bahuno katissa ca nuka hoti tiliṅge.

original: Namhī bahuno katissa ca nuka hoti tiliṅge-bahunnaṃsesaṃ bhikkhusamaṃ-bahu. Bahavo,
analyzed: na mhi bahunaḥ katissa ca nu ka hoti bhikkhu samam bahu bahavaḥ
translated: The rest is like bhikkhu.

original: bahū-(bho) bahu, bahu, bahave, bahavo, bahu bahuṃ, bahavo, bahu-bahunā. Bahuhi,bahūbhi-bahuno,
analyzed: bahu ubhaḥ bahu bahu bahave bahavaḥ bahu bahum bahavaḥ bahu bahunā bahu hi bahu bahunā
translated: Bahuno, bahū-(bho) bahu, bahu, bahave, bahavo, bahu bahuṃ, bahavo, bahu-bahunā. Bahuhi,bahūbhi-bahuno,

original: bahussa, bahunnaṃ-bahunā, bahumhā. Bahusmā-bahumhi, bahusmiṃ, bahusu-vattusi.
analyzed: bahussa bahunnam bahunā bahumhā bahusmā abahumhi bahusmin bahusuvattusi
translated: Bahussa, bahunnaṃ-bahunā, bahumhā. Bahusmā-bahumhi, bahusmiṃ, bahusu-vattusi.

original: Latupitādinamā simhi.
analyzed: la tu pi tā di namā simhi
translated: Latupitādinamā simhi.

original: Latuppaccayantānaṃ pitu mātu bhātu dhītu duhitu jāmātu nattu hotu potunañcā hoti simhi-vattā.
analyzed: pitu mātu bhātu dhītu duhitu jāmātu nattu hotu potunañcā hoti simhivattā
translated: Latuppaccayantānaṃ pitu mātu bhātu dhītu duhitu jāmātu nattu hotu potunañcā hoti simhi-vattā.

original: Latupitādinamase.
analyzed: la tu pi ta ādi namase
translated: Latupitādinamase.

original: Latuppaccayantānaṃ pitādinaṃ cāraṅi hoti satoññatra-“āraṅismā”ti ṭo-vattāro.
analyzed: la tup paccaya antānam ca āraṅi hoti sataḥ uññatra āraṅi sma ati ṭo vat tāraḥ
translated: Latuppaccayantānaṃ pitādinaṃ cāraṅi hoti satoññatra-“āraṅismā”ti ṭo-vattāro.

original: Ge ā ca.
analyzed: ge ā ca
translated: Ge ā ca.

original: Latupitādīnaṃ a hoti ge ā ca-(bho) vatta, vattā. Vattāro, vattāraṃ. Vattāre, vattāro-nāvacanassa “ṭānāsmāna”nti ṭā-vattārā.
analyzed: la tup ita ādīnam a hoti ge ā cabhaḥ vatta vattā vattāraḥ vattāram vattāre vattāraḥ na a vacanassa ṭā na a smān anti ṭā vattārā
translated: The affix a is added to latu, etc., and the affix ā to ge, and the affix vatta to bho. The forms are: vattāro, vattāraṃ, vattāre, vattāro.

original: Suhisvāraṅi
analyzed: su hi svāraṅi
translated: The affix āraṅi is added to suhi.

original: Subhisu tupitādīnamāraṅi vā hoti-vattārehi, vattārebhi, vattūhi, vattūbhi.
analyzed: su bhi su tupi ta ādīnam āraṅi vā hotivattārehi vattārebhi vattūhi vattūbhi
translated: The affix āraṅi is added to subhisu, and the affix āraṅi is added to latu, etc. The forms are: vattārehi, vattārebhi, vattūhi, vattūbhi.

original: Salopo.🔽Latupitādīhisassa lopo vā hoti-vattu, navattuno, vattussa.
analyzed: sa lopaḥ  la tu pita ādī hisassa lopaḥ vā hoti vattu na vattunaḥ vattussa
translated: The affix lopo is added to salo.🔽The affix lopo is added to latu, etc. The forms are: vattā, navattuno, vattussa.

original: Namhi vā.🔽Namhi latupatādinamāraṅi vā hoti-vattārānaṃaññatra.🔽Namhi latupitādīnamāvā hoti-vattānaṃ. Vattunaṃ-smāssa vā-vattārā.
analyzed: namhi vā  namhi la tu pa tādi nam āraṅi vā hoti vat tārā naṃ aññatra  namhi la tu pita ādīnam āvā hoti vattānam vattu naṃsmā assa vāvattārā
translated: The affix namhi is added to latu, etc.🔽The affix namhi is added to latu, etc., except āraṅi. The forms are: vattārānaṃ, aññatra, vattārānaṃ.

original: Ṭismino.
analyzed: ṭi sminaḥ
translated: The affix namhi is added to latu, etc., and the affix āvā is added to latu, etc. The forms are: vattānaṃ, vattunaṃ, smāssa vā, vattārā.

original: Āraṅādesamhāsmano ṭi hoti.
analyzed: āra ṅ āde samha asmanaḥ ṭi hoti
translated: The affix ṭi is added to smim.🔽The affix ṭi is added to smim, āraṅi, etc.

original: Rassāra ṅi.🔽Smimhi āro rasso hoti-vattari, vattāresu, vattusu-evaṃ bhattu hottu ādayo-satthusaddassa pana namhi bahulādhikārā vā āraṅādese-satthārā, satthunā-pitā.
analyzed: ras sāraḥ ṅi  āraḥ rassaḥ hoti vattari vattāresu vattusu evam bhattu hottu ādayo satthu saddassa pana namhi bahula adhikārā vā
translated: The affix raṅi is added to ras.🔽The affix raṅi is added to smim. The forms are: vattari, vattāresu, vattasu. In the same way, bhattu hottu, etc. But the affix āraṅi is added to satthu by the general rule, not by the special rule. The forms are: satthārā, satthunā.

original: Pitādinamanatvādinaṃ
analyzed: pitā dinam anatvā dinam
translated: The affix ā is added to pitā, etc., and the affix atvā, etc., is added to atvā, etc.

original: Natvādivajjitānaṃ pitādinamāro rasso hoti sabbāsu vibhattisu-pitaro iccādi cattusamaṃ-rassova viseso-natvādi nantu rassābhāvā nattāro iccādi guṇavantusi.🔽Ntussa.🔽Simhi ntussa ṭā hoti-guṇavā-ntuva vantvādi sambandhiyeva gayhate ntuvantumantvāvantutavantusambandhi’ti vacanato na jantutanatvādinaṃ-yo-ntantunamādināvānto-guṇavanto aññatra.🔽Yvādo ntussa.
analyzed: natvā ādi vat jitānam rassaḥ hoti sabbāsu vibhatti supitaraḥ iccādi nantu rassa abhāvāḥ nattāraḥ iccādi  ntussa  simhi ntussa ṭā vantu ādi sambandhiyā iva gayhate vacanataḥ na aññatra  y v ādaḥ ntus sa
translated: The word āro is masculine in all cases, as in pitaro, etc. The only difference is that it is masculine. But in the neuter, because of the absence of the masculine, it is as in nattāro, etc.🔽In ntussa.🔽In the nominative singular, ṭā is substituted for ntussa, as in guṇavā. The words vantvādi are connected only with ntuvantumantvāvantutavantusambandhi, according to the rule, therefore jantutanatvādi are not included. The words yo-ntantunamādināvānta are connected with guṇavanto, except in the case of the nominative singular.🔽In yvādo ntussa.🔽

original: Yavādisu ntussa a hoti-akārantattā ṭā-guṇavantā-na ce ha avidhānasāmatthiyā aptti🔽avidhānassa caritatthatāya guṇavantassāti-(bho) guṇava,guṇavā, guṇavaṃ, guṇavanto,🔽guṇavantā-guṇavaṃ, guṇavantaṃ, guṇavante-guṇavatā, guṇavantena, guṇavantehi, guṇavantebhi-guṇavato,
analyzed: yava ādisu ntussa a hoti akāra anta ttā ce ha a vidhāna sāmatthiyā ap tti 🔽a vidhānassa caritattha tāya guṇavantaḥ atibhaḥ guṇava guṇavā guṇavam guṇavantaḥ 🔽guṇavantā a guṇavam guṇavantam guṇavante guṇavatā guṇavantena guṇavantehi guṇavantebhiḥ guṇavataḥ
translated: The word āro is masculine in all cases, as pitā, etc. The fourfold equality of the declensions is shown in the following: pitaraṃ, pitara, pitara, pitara; pituno, pitunā, pitunā, pitubhi, pitubhi; pituno, pituno, pituno, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pitūnaṃ, pit

original: guṇavassa, guṇavantassa, guṇavataṃ. Guṇavantānaṃ-guṇavatā, guṇavantā, guṇavantamhā,
analyzed: guṇavassa guṇavantassa guṇavatam guṇavantā anaṃguṇavatā guṇavantā guṇavantamhā
translated: Guṇavassa, guṇavantassa, guṇavataṃ. Guṇavantānaṃ-guṇavatā, guṇavantā, guṇavantamhā,

original: guṇavantasmā-guṇavati, guṇavante, guṇavantamhi. Guṇavantasmiṃ, guṇavantesu-evaṃ maghavantu
analyzed: guṇavantasma a guṇavati guṇavante guṇavantamhi guṇavantesu guṇavantesu evam maghavan
translated: Guṇavantasmā-guṇavati, guṇavante, guṇavantamhi. Guṇavantasmiṃ, guṇavantesu-evaṃ maghavantu

original: bhagavantuppabhutayo.
analyzed: bhagavantuppabhutayaḥ
translated: Bhagavantuppabhutayo.

original: Himavato vā o.
analyzed: himavataḥ vā o
translated: Himavato vā o.

original: Himavato simhi ntussa o vā hoti-himavanto, himavā-sesaṃ guṇavāva.
analyzed: himavataḥ simhi n tussa o vā hoti himavantaḥ guṇavāva
translated: Himavato simhi ntussa o vā hoti-himavanto, himavā-sesaṃ guṇavāva.

original: Abhagohi ṭo
analyzed: a bhagohi ṭaḥ

analyzed: ubhagohi goḥ goḥ gavaḥ

original: Gāvumhi.
analyzed: gāvumhi

analyzed: aṃvacane goḥ gāvaḥ gāvaḥ gavaḥ  na assā
translated: In the instrumental and ablative cases, gāvī becomes gāva-gāvī, gāva, gavo, gāvo, gavo.🔽In the genitive case, gāvī becomes gāvam.

original: Goto nāssa ā hoti vā-gāvā, gāvena, gavā, gavena gohi, gobhi.🔽Gavaṃ sena
analyzed: gotaḥ na assa ā hoti vā agāvā gāvena gavā gavena gohi gobhi  gavam sena

original: Gossa se vā gavaṃ hoti saha sena-gavaṃ, gāvassa, gavassa.🔽Gunnañca nantā.🔽Naṃvacanena saha gossa gunnaṃ hoti gavañca vā-gunnaṃ gamaṃ, gonaṃ-gāvā, gāvamhā, gāvasmā, gavā, gavamhā, gavasmā-gāve, gāvamhi, gāvasmiṃ, gave, gavamhi, gavasmiṃ.

analyzed: gossa sumhi gāva gavā honti vā agāvesu gavesu gosu  okāra antam pulliṅgam
translated: In the cow, the cow-word is gāvī, gāve, gāve.🔽The feminine ending in -ī is declined like the neuter ending in -a.

original: Kaññā.
analyzed: kaññā

original: Sā.
analyzed: sā
translated: She.

original: Itthiyaṃ vattamānassa nāmassante vattamāno ākāro ghasañño hoti-jantvādinā vāyolopo-kaññā, kaññāyo-“ghabrahmādite”ti gassevā-kaññe, kaññā-yomhi-kaññā, kaññāyo.
analyzed: itthiyam vattamānassa vattamānaḥ ākāraḥ gha saññaḥ hoti jantu ādinā vāyo lopaḥ ukaññā kaññā yogha brahma ādi tā iti gassa iva a kaññe kaññāyomhikaññā kaññāyo
translated: The form of the feminine ending in -ī is considered to be gha, and the ya is elided by the rule beginning with “jantvādi”. A girl, girls. “Gha, brahmā, etc.”, so only gha. A girl, girls. I am a girl, girls. A girl, girls.

original: Gho ssaṃsasāsasāyaṃtiṃsu🔽Ssamādisu gho rasso hoti-kaññaṃ, kaññā, kaññāyo-
analyzed: ghaḥ ssaṃsasāsasāyaṃtiṃsu  s s am ādisu ghaḥ rassaḥ hoti kaññam kaññā kaññāyaḥ
translated: Gha, ssa, sa, sa, ā, in, su,🔽Gha becomes short in ssa, etc. A girl, girls, girls.

original: Ghapatekasmiṃ nadīnaṃ yayā.
analyzed: ghapata ikasmin nadīnam yayā
translated: In one of the rivers, by the feminine.

original: Ghapato nadīnamekasmiṃ yayā honti yathākkamaṃ-kaññāya, kaññāhi, kaññābhi-kaññāya, kaññānaṃ, -smimhi-
