original: Yaṃ.
analyzed: yam
translated: What?🔽🔽

original: Ghapato smino yaṃ vā hoti-kaññāyaṃ. Kaññāya, kaññāsu. Evaṃ saddhā sudhā sukhāādayo-“nāmmādīhī”ti ammā annā ambāhi gassa ekārābhāve.
analyzed: gha pataḥ sminaḥ yam vā hoti kaññāyam kaññāya kaññāsu evam saddhā sudhā sukhā ādayo na amma ādīhi iti ammā annā ambāhi gassa ekāra abhāve
translated: Or yaṃ is used in the locative by the feminine. In a girl, in a girl, in girls. Thus saddhā, sudhā, sukhā, etc. “In nāmmādīhi”, ammā, annā, ambāhi, by the absence of the e-vowel in gha.

original: Rasso vā.
analyzed: rassaḥ vā
translated: Or short.

analyzed: amma ādīnam ge rassaḥ vā hoti amma ammā icca ādise sam kaññā vasahā parisāhi sminoti sabhā parisāya ati
translated: Gha becomes short in ammā, etc. Amma, ammā, etc. The rest is like a girl. In the locative singular of sahāparisāhi, “sabhāparisāyā”

original: tiṃ vā hoti “ghossa” miccādinā rasse-sahatiṃ-aññatra-sahāyaṃ, sahāya-parisatiṃ, parisāyaṃ, parisāya.
analyzed: tim vā hoti ghossa m iti ādinā sahāya parisatim parisāyam parisāya
translated: or 10 times “voice” with the wrong beginning “ghosa” and so on, with rasse, sahati, aññatra, sahāya, sahāya-parisati, parisāya, parisāya.

original: Ākārantaṃ.
analyzed: ākāra antam

original: Mati-yomhi-
analyzed: matiyā asmi

original: Pitthiyaṃ.
analyzed: pitthiyam

analyzed: itthiyam vattamānassa vattamānāḥ ivaṇṇuvaṇṇāḥ pasaññāḥ honti

original: Yepassavaṇṇassa.
analyzed: ye passa vaṇṇassa
translated: Yepassavaṇṇassa.

analyzed: matiyam matyā matiyā matīsu evam kitti kanti sminaḥ rati ādīhi vaḥ

translated: smino” ratyādīhivo smino “ti ṭo vā-ratte-aññatra-ratyaṃ, rattiyaṃ, ratyā, rattiyā-the rest is the same as with matiyā.

original: Ikārantaṃ.
analyzed: ikāra antam
translated: Ikāranta

original: Dāsī, dāsyo, dāsī, dāsiyo-(bho)dāsi, dāsī, dāsyo, dāsī, dāsiyo.🔽Yaṃ pīto.
analyzed: dāsī dāsyaḥ dāsī dāsiyā ubhodāsi dāsī dāsyaḥ dāsī dāsiyo  yam
translated: (Bho) female slave, female slaves, a female slave, female slaves.🔽The form yaṃ is used in the instrumental and ablative cases of the feminine.🔽The form dāsiyaṃ is used in the locative case.

original: Pasaññito aṃvacanassa yaṃ vā hoti-dāsyaṃ, dāsiyaṃ, dāsiṃ, dāsyo, dāsī, dāsiyo-dāsyā,
analyzed: pa saññitaḥ aṃ vacanassa yam vā hoti dāsyam dāsiyam dāsim dāsyaḥ dāsī dāsiyā udāsyā

original: dāsiyā, dāsīhi, dāsībhi-dāsyā, dāsiyā, dāsīnaṃ-dāsyaṃ, dāsiyaṃ, dāsyā, dāsiyā, dāsīsu-evamosadhī
analyzed: dāsiyā dāsīhi dāsībhiḥ dāsyā dāsiyā dāsīnam dāsyam dāsiyam dāsyā dāsiyā
translated: The forms dāsīsu and evamosadhī are used in the ablative case.

original: pokkharaṇī ādayo-nadisaddā yosu-🔽Najjā yosvāma.
analyzed: pokkharaṇī ādayaḥ nadi saddāḥ yosu  najjā yosvāma
translated: The forms pokkharaṇī and ādayo are used in the locative case.

original: Yosu nadisaddassa āma vā hoti-saca.🔽Manubandho sarānamantā paro.
analyzed: yosu nadi saddassa āma vā hoti saca  manubandho paras
translated: The forms yosu and nadisaddā are used in the ablative case.🔽The form najjā is used in the locative case.🔽The form āma is used in the ablative case of the feminine.

original: Makāronubandho yassa so sarānamantā sarā paro hotī’ti īkārā paro-“yavā sare”ti yakāre dassa cavaggo yassa pubba rūpaṃ-najjāyo-aññatra-vā palopayolopesu-najjo, nadī, nadiyo iccādi.
analyzed: makāraḥ anubandhaḥ yassa saḥ sarā namantā sarā paraḥ hoti iti īkārā sarā iti yakāre dassa ca vaggaḥ yassa nadī nadiyaḥ iccādi
translated: The form sarānamantā is used in the nominative and accusative cases.

original: Īkārantaṃ.
analyzed: īkāra antam
translated: The form sarā is used in the vocative case.🔽The form yavā is used in the ablative case.🔽The form yavā is used in the ablative case.

original: Yāgu, yāgu, yāguyo-(bho)yāgu, yāgu, yāguyo-yāguṃ, yāgu, yāguyo-yāguyā, yāguhi, yāgubhi-yāguyā,
analyzed: yāgu yāgu yāgu yobhoyāgu yāgu yāgu yoyāgum yāgu yāgu yoyāgu yāgu yāgu yoyāgu yā yāgu hi yāgubhi yāgu yā
translated: The form najjāyo is used in the nominative and accusative cases.🔽The form najjo is used in the locative case.🔽The form najjo is used in the locative case.🔽The form najjo is used in the locative case.

original: yāgunaṃ-yāguyaṃ, yāguyā, yāgusu-evaṃ dhenu sassu piyaṅguppabhutayo-mātu dhītu duhitu
analyzed: yāgunam yāguyam yāguyā dhenu dhītu duhitu
translated: Yāgu, yāgu, yāgū, yāguṃ, yāguyo, yāguyā, yāguhi, yāguyo, yāguyā, yāgunāṃ, yāguyā, yāgusu. In the same way, dhenu, sassu, piyaṅgu, pabhu, mātā, dhītā, dhītā,

original: saddā pitusaddasamā-salopābhāvapakkhe yādese mātusaddassa pana “ye passā”ti yogavibhāgā
analyzed: saddā pitu sadda samāsa lopa abhāva pakkhe ya ādese mātu saddassa pana ye yogavibhāgā
translated: The sound of a father is the same, but without the salop, in the case of the declension of the sound of a mother, “ye passā”.

original: vā palopo-matyā, mātuyā.
analyzed: vā palopomatyā
translated: Or the salop is dropped, mātā, mātuyā.

original: Ukārantaṃ.
analyzed: ukāra antam
translated: The feminine ending in ū.

original: Vadhū, vadhū, vadhuyo-(bho)vadhu, vadhu, vadhuyo-vadhuṃ, vadhū, vadhuyo-vadhuyā, vadhūhi, vadhūbhi-vadhuyā, vadhūnaṃ-vadhuyaṃ, vadhuyā, vadhūsu-evaṃ jambu vāmorū sarabhu ādayo.
analyzed: vadhū vadhū vadhuyobhovadhu vadhu vadhuyovadhum vadhū vadhuyovadhuyā vadhū vadhuyovadhuyā vadhūhi vadhūbhi vadhuyā vadhūnam vadhuyam vadhuyā vadhūsu evam jambu vāma ūrū sarabhu
translated: Vadhū, vadhū, vadhūyo, (bho)vadhū, vadhū, vadhūyo, vadhū, vadhūyo, vadhūhi, vadhūbhi, vadhūhi, vadhūnāṃ, vadhūyaṃ, vadhūhi, vadhūsu. In the same way, jambu, vāma, rū, sarabhū, etc.

original: Ūkārantaṃ.
analyzed: ūkāra antam
translated: The feminine ending in ū.

original: Go iccādi pumena samaṃ.
analyzed: go i t ca ādi pumena samam
translated: The feminine is the same as the masculine in go, etc.

original: Itthiliṅgaṃ.
analyzed: itthi liṅgam
translated: The feminine gender.

original: Cittasi.
analyzed: cit tasi
translated: In cittā.

original: Aṃ napuṃsake.
analyzed: am napuṃsake
translated: The neuter in aṃ.

original: Akārantato nāmasmā sissa aṃ hoti napuṃsakaliṅge-mittaṃ-yomhi.
analyzed: akāra antataḥ nāmasmā si ssa am hoti napuṃsaka liṅga imittaṃyos
translated: From a noun ending in a, aṃ is in the neuter gender - mittaṃ.

original: Yonanti.
analyzed: yonanti
translated: The feminine in yon.

original: Akārantato nāmasmā yonaṃ nī hoti napuṃsake’ti ni ādeso.
analyzed: akāra antataḥ nāmasmai hoti napuṃsaka iti ni ādesaḥ
translated: From a noun ending in a, yonaṃ is ni in the neuter - cittāni.

original: Nīnaṃ vā.
analyzed: nīnam vā
translated: Or the feminine in nīnaṃ.

original: Akārantato nāmasmā nīnaṃ ṭāṭe vā honti yathākkamaṃ-cittā, aññatra-“yolopanīsu dīgho”tidīghe-cittāni-(bho)
analyzed: akāra antataḥ nāmasmā nīnam ṭā ṭe vā honti yathākkamam cittāḥ añña trayolopanīsu
translated: From a noun ending in a, nīnaṃ is ṭāṭe in the neuter, respectively - cittā, aññatra. “Yolopanīsu dīgho” ti dīghe - cittāni.

original: citta, cittā, cittā, cittāni-cittaṃ, citte, cittāni-citteneccādi buddhasaddasamaṃ-evaṃ
analyzed: citta cittā cittā cittāni cittam citte cittāni cittena icca ādi
translated: citta, cittā, cittā, cittāni-cittaṃ, citte, cittāni-cittena, etc. like the word buddha.

original: pānadānappabhutayo-ekaccādinaṃ tu paṭhamānimhi viseso.
analyzed: tu visesaḥ
translated: Thus the words beginning with pāna-dāna are formed. But there is a difference in the first (case) and so on.

original: Na nissa ṭā.
analyzed: na nis ṭā
translated: Not nissa ṭā.

original: Ekaccādīhi parassa nissa ṭā na hoti-ekaccāni, paṭhamāni-padādīhi nāsmiṃsu.
analyzed: ekacca ādīhi parassa nissa ṭā na hoti ekaccāni paṭhama ani pada ādīhi na asmiṃsu
translated: With ekaccā and so on, the nissa ṭā of another is not, ekaccāni, paṭhamāni-with padā and so on, not in the nominative.

original: Nāssa sā.
analyzed: na assa sā
translated: Not nāssa sā.

original: Padādihi nāssa sā hoti vā-padasā, padesa-bilasā, bilena.
analyzed: pada ādi hi na assa sā hoti bilena
translated: With padā and so on, nāssa sā is, padasa, padesa-bilasa, bilena.

original: Padādihi si.
analyzed: pada ādi hi si
translated: With padā and so on, si.

original: Ehi smino si hoti vā-padasi, pade, padamhi, padasmiṃ-kamma saddato nāssa“nāsseno”ti
analyzed: ehi smin u si hoti vā a padasi pade padamhi padasmiṃkamma saddataḥ
translated: With ehi smino si is, padasi, pade, padamhi, padasmiṃ-from kamma and sadda, not nāssa “nāsseno”.

original: eno vā-kammena-aññatra pumādinā vā utte-kammunā, kammanā-imināva sasmāsu uttaṃ-tassa
analyzed: enaḥ vā a kammena aññatra pum ādinā vā sa sma āsu
translated: Or enova-with kamma-apart from pumā and so on, or utta-kammunā, kammanā-with this very sasmā, utta-of that

original: lasaññāyaṃ-sasmānaṃ yathāyogaṃ nonā niccaṃ-vavatthitavibhāsāyaṃ-kammuno, kammassa-kammunā,
analyzed: yathāyogam na ūnā niccam vavatthita vibhāsa ayam kammuno
translated: in the sense of lasa-of sasmāna, as appropriate, not always-in this analysis of the definition, kammuno, kammassa-with kammunā,

original: kammā, kammamhā, kammasmā-“kammādito”ti smino vā nimhi-kammani, kamme, kammamhi,
analyzed: kammā kammamhā kammasmā kammāditaḥ iti sminaḥ vā nimhi kammani kamme kammamhi
translated: kammā, kammamhā, kammasmā-“kammādito” in the smino, or nimhi-kammani, kamme, kammamhi,

original: kammasmiṃ-sesaṃ cittasamaṃ-camma vesma bhasmādayo kammasmā uttatoññatra-gacchantasi-“ntassaṃ”ti
analyzed: cittasamaṃcamma bhasma ādayaḥ kammasma
translated: In ‘camma vesma bhasmādayo’ the ‘a’ is elided in ‘kammasmā uttato’.🔽In ‘aññatra gacchantasi’ the ‘a’ is elided in ‘gacchantassa’.🔽In ‘gacchaṃ aññatra sissa aṃ’ the ‘a’ is elided in ‘gacchantaṃ’.

original: vā amhisilopo-gacchaṃ-aññatra sissa aṃ-gacchantaṃ, gacchantā gacchantāni-(bho)gaccha,
analyzed: vā amhi si lopaḥ gacchan aññatra si ssa aṃgacchantam gacchantā gacchantā nibhogaccha
translated: In ‘gacchantā gacchantāni’ the ‘a’ is elided in ‘gaccha’.🔽In ‘gaccha gacchā gacchaṃ gacchantā gacchantāni’ the ‘a’ is elided in ‘gacchaṃ’.🔽In ‘gacchaṃ gacchantaṃ gacchante gacchantāni’ the ‘a’ is elided in ‘gacchaṃ’.

original: gacchā, gacchaṃ, gacchantā, gacchantāni-gacchaṃ, gacchantaṃ, gacchante, gacchantāni-nādisu🔽pulliṅgasmaṃ-evaṃ yajanta vajantādayo.
analyzed: gaccha gaccham gacchantā gacchantā anigaccham gacchantam gacchante gacchantā aninādisu  yajanta vajanta ādayaḥ
translated: In ‘gacchantaṃ gacchante gacchantāni’ the ‘a’ is elided in ‘gacchantaṃ’.

original: Akārantaṃ.🔽Aṭṭhi🔽Jhalā vā.
analyzed: akāra antam  aṭṭhi  jha lā vā
translated: In ‘gacchantā gacchantāni’ the ‘a’ is elided in ‘gacchantā’.🔽In ‘gaccha gacchā gacchaṃ gacchantā gacchantāni’ the ‘a’ is elided in ‘gacchaṃ’.🔽In ‘gacchaṃ gacchantaṃ gacchante gacchantāni’ the ‘a’ is elided in ‘gacchaṃ’.

original: Jhalato yonaṃ ni hoti vā napuṃsakaliṅge-aṭṭhini-yo lopadighesu-aṭṭhi-(bho)aṭṭhi,
analyzed: jha lataḥ yonam ni hoti vā napuṃsaka liṅga aṭṭhiniyaḥ lopa digha su aṭṭhi bho aṭṭhi
translated: In ‘gacchantaṃ gacchante gacchantāni’ the ‘a’ is elided in ‘gacchantaṃ’.🔽In ‘gacchantā gacchantāni’ the ‘a’ is elided in ‘gacchantā’.🔽In ‘gaccha gacchā gacchaṃ gacchantā gacchantāni’ the ‘a’ is elided in ‘gacchaṃ’.🔽In ‘gacchaṃ gacchantaṃ gacchante gacchantāni’ the ‘a’ is elided in ‘gacchaṃ’.

original: aṭṭhīni, aṭṭhī-aṭṭhiṃ, aṭṭhini, aṭṭhi = tatiyādisu munisaddasamaṃ-evamacchi akkhi dadhi satthi ādayo.

translated: In ‘gacchantaṃ gacchante gacchantāni’ the ‘a’ is elided in ‘gacchantaṃ’.🔽In ‘gacchantā gacchantāni’ the ‘a’ is elided in ‘gacchantā’.

original: Ikārantaṃ.
analyzed: ikāra antam
translated: In ‘gaccha gacchā gacchaṃ gacchant

original: Daṇḍī-“ekavacane”ccādinā rasso-silopo-daṇḍīni, daddhī-(bho)daṇḍi, daṇḍī, daṇḍīni, daddhī-daṇḍinaṃ,daṇḍiṃ, daṇḍīni, daṇḍī-sesaṃ pulliṅgasmaṃ-evaṃ sukhakārī sīghayāyī ādayo.
analyzed: daṇḍī ekavacana icca ādinā daddhī bhodaṇḍi daṇḍī daṇḍīni daddhī daṇḍinaṃdaṇḍim daṇḍīni daṇḍīsesam sukhakārī sīghayāyī ādayaḥ
translated: Daṇḍī, “in the singular” and so on, the vowel-sandhi, elision of syllables, is Daṇḍīni, Daddhī-(bho)daṇḍi, Daṇḍī, Daṇḍīni, Daddhī-daṇḍinaṃ, Daṇḍiṃ, Daṇḍīni, Daṇḍī-the rest is the same as in the masculine. Thus Sukhakārī, Sīghayāyī and so on.

original: Īkārantaṃ.
analyzed: īkāra antam
translated: The ending in i.

original: Cakkhu, cakkhuni, cakkhu-aṭṭhisaddasama-evamāyu madhu matthu dhanu cittaguppabhutayo-āyusāti
analyzed: cakkhu cakkhuni madhu matthu
translated: Cakkhu, cakkhuni, cakkhu-the same as the word for bone. Thus Āyu, Madhu, Matthu, Dhanu, Citta, Guppa, Bhutayo-Āyusāti

original: kodhādittā nāssa sā vā-ambusaddā smino“ambavādīhī”ti vā ni ādesā-ambuni, ambumhi, ambusmiṃ.
analyzed: kodhāt ittā sā vā ambu saddā vā ni ādesā ambuni ambumhi ambusmin
translated: Kodhādittā nāssa sā vā-the word for water. “Ambavādīhī” or ni ādesā-Ambuni, Ambumhi, Ambusmiṃ.

original: Guṇavantusi.
analyzed: guṇavan tusi
translated: Guṇavantasi.

original: Addhaṃnapuṃsake.
analyzed: addham napuṃsake
translated: Addhaṃnapuṃsake.

original: Ntussa addhaṃ hoti simhi napuṃsake-guṇavaṃ, guṇavantaṃ-yomhi-“yavādontussā”ti akāre“yonaṃ
analyzed: n tussa addham hoti simhi napuṃsake guṇavam ati akāre yonam
translated: Addhaṃ is for ntussa in the neuter. Guṇavaṃ, Guṇavantaṃ-yomhi-“Yavādontussā” ti akāre“Yonaṃ

original: nī”ti ni tassa vā ṭādese-guṇavanatāniccādi-gacchantasamaṃ-evaṃ yasavantu dhanavantu gomantvādayo.
analyzed: ni iti ni tassa vā ṭā dese guṇavana tā nicca ādi gacchanta samam evam yasavantu dhanavantu gomantu ādayaḥ
translated: nī” ti ni tassa vā ṭādese-Guṇavanatāniccādi-the same as the word for going. Thus Yasavantu, Dhanavantu, Gomantvādayo.

original: Ukārantaṃ.
analyzed: ukāra antam
translated: The ending in u.

original: Gotrabhu, gotrabhuti, gotrabhu-(bho)gotrabhu, gotrabhuni, gotrabhu-gotrabhuṃ, gotrabhuti,
analyzed: gotrabhu gotrabhuti gotrabhu bhogotrabhu gotrabhuni gotrabhu gotrabhum gotrabhuti
translated: Gotrabhu, gotrabhuti, gotrabhu-(bho)gotrabhu, gotrabhuni, gotrabhu-gotrabhuṃ, gotrabhuti,

original: gotrabhu-gotrabhunā iccādi pulliṅge vessabhusaddasamaṃ-evaṃ abhibhu sayamabhu dhammañña ādayo.
analyzed: gotrabhu gotrabhunā iccādi pul liṅge abhibhu sayamabhu dhammaññaḥ ādayaḥ
translated: Gotrabhu, gotrabhunā, etc. In the masculine, like the word vessabhu. So too abhibhu, sayamabhu, dhammañña, etc.

original: Ūkārantaṃ-napuṃsakaliṅgaṃ.🔽Atha sabbādīnaṃ rūpanayo niddisīyate-sabba katara katama ubhaya itara añña aññatara🔽aññatama pubba parāpara dakkhiṇuttarādha rānivavatthāyamasaññāyaṃ-ya tya ta eta ima
analyzed: ūkāra antam napuṃsaka liṅgam  atha sabba ādīnam rūpa nayaḥ niddisīyate  aññatama pubba para apara dakkhiṇa uttara adha tya te ete ima
translated: The feminine is ended in ū.🔽Now the method of the declension of all, etc., is pointed out: all, which, which one, both, other, another, one of two, one of many, former, later, right, left, above, below, in front, behind, in the sense of defining, that, those, this, these, that, those, what, one, you, we—these all, etc.

original: amu kiṃ eka tumhaamha iccete sabbādayo-sabbo.
analyzed: amu kim eka tumha amhaḥ iti ete sabba ādayaḥ sabbaḥ
translated: All is sabba.

original: Yonameṭa.
analyzed: yaḥ nama iṭa
translated: The ending is eṭ.

original: Akārantehi sabbādihi yonameṭa hoti-sabbe-evamālapana dutiyāyosu.
analyzed: akāra antehi sabba ādihi hoti sabbe evam ālapana dutiya yosu
translated: The ending eṭ is used with all, etc., that do not end in a vowel: sabbe—so too ālapana in the dual.

original: Sabbādīnaṃ namhi ca.🔽Akārantānaṃ sabbādīnaṃ e hoti namhi suhisu ca.
analyzed: sabba ādīnam namhi ca  akāra antānam sabba ādīnam e hoti na mhi su hi su ca
translated: Of all, etc., naṃ and vac.

original: Saṃsānaṃ.
analyzed: saṃsānam
translated: The ending e is used with all, etc., that do not end in a vowel, in naṃ, vac, suhi, and su.🔽Of the dual of all, etc.

original: Sabbādito naṃvacanassa saṃsānaṃ honti-sabbesaṃ, sabbesānaṃ-sesaṃ buddhasamaṃ-itthiyaṃ
analyzed: sabba ādeḥ naṃ vacanassa saṃ sa anam honti sabbesam buddha samam itthiyam
translated: The endings of the dual are used for the word naṃ of all, etc.: sabbesaṃ, sabbesānaṃ—the rest is like buddha. In the feminine

original: “itthiyamatvā”ti āppaccaye saralope ca kate ākārassa ghasaññāyaṃ kaññāsaddasseva
analyzed: itthiya matvā ati āp paccaye sara lope ca kate ākārassa gha saññā āyam kaññā saddassa iva
translated: “In the feminine, not” is said. After the affix ā is elided and the vowel sign is changed to -g-, the word kaññā is formed.

original: rūpanayo, ayantu viseso.
analyzed: rūpa nayaḥ visesaḥ
translated: The method of the declension is this, but this is the difference.

original: Ghapā sassa ssā vā.
analyzed: gha pā sassa ssā vā
translated: Ghapā sassa ssā vā.

original: Sabbādīnaṃ ghapato sassa ssā vā hoti-“ghossa”miccādanā rasse-sabbassā. Sabbāya-namhi-sabbāsaṃ. Sabbāsānaṃ.
analyzed: sabba ādīnam gha pataḥ sa ssaḥ ssā vā hoti ghossam iti ādanā rasse sabbassā sabbāyanamhisabbāsam sabbāsānam
translated: Of all, etc., sassa ssā vā is added to ghapā. “Ghossa” is incorrect. Of all, of all. Of all, of all. Of all, of all.

translated: Smino ssaṃ.

translated: nesānaṃ, tesaṃ, tesānaṃ, -amhā, asmā, namhā, nasmā, tamhā, tasmā, -amhi, asmiṃ, namhi,

translated: nasmiṃ, tambhi, tasmiṃ, nesu, tesu, -itthiyaṃ, -sā, nā, nāyo, tā, tāyo, -naṃ, taṃ, nā,

original: nāyo, tā, tāyo-nāmhi kate-
analyzed: kate
translated: nāyo, tā, tāyo, -nāmhi kate,

original: Ssā vā tetimāmūhi.🔽Ghapasaññehi tā etā imā amūhi nādanamekasmiṃ ssā vā hoti-vā ṭā dese-assā, nassā, nāya.
analyzed: vā  tāḥ etāḥ imāḥ amūhi na adanam ekasmin vā hoti vā dese assā nassā nāya
translated: Or in the instrumental case.🔽In the instrumental case of these words, the ending is either -e or -ā.🔽In the ablative case.🔽In the ablative case of these words, the ending is either -e or -ā.🔽In the genitive case.

original: Tāya vā.
analyzed: tāya vā
translated: In the genitive case of these words, the ending is either -e or -ā.🔽In the nominative case.🔽In the nominative case of these words, the ending is either -e or -ā.🔽In the vocative case.

original: Ssaṃssāssāyesu tassa vā i hoti-tissā, tassā, tāya-nāhi, nābhi, tāhi, tābhi-sassa vā ssāmhi-assā, nassā, tissā, tassā, ssādesābhāvapakkhe.
analyzed: tassa vā i hoti tissā tassā vā nassā tissā tassā ssā desa abhāva pakkhe
translated: In the vocative case of these words, the ending is either -e or -ā.

original: Tetimāto sassa ssāya.
analyzed: teti mā taḥ sassa ssāya
translated: In the locative case.

original: Tā etā imāto sassa ssāyo hoti vā-assāya, nassāya,
analyzed: tāḥ etāḥ ssāyaḥ hoti vāassāya nassāya
translated: In the locative case of these words, the ending is either -e or -ā.🔽In the instrumental case.🔽In the instrumental case of these words, the ending is either -e or -ā.🔽In the ablative case.

original: Tissāya, tassāya-dvihi muttapakkhe-tāya tāya-naṃvacanassa samādese takārassa ca vā
analyzed: tissāya tassāya dvihi mutta pakkha itāya tāyanaṃvacanassa samādese takārassa ca vā
translated: In the ablative case of these words, the ending is either -e or -ā.

original: ṭādese “sunaṃhisu“ti dīghe ca kate-āsaṃ, nāsaṃ, nāsānaṃ, tāsaṃ, tāsānaṃ-sattamiyaṃ-assaṃ,🔽assā, nassaṃ, nassā, nāyaṃ, nāya, tissaṃ, tissā, tassaṃ, tassā, tāyaṃ, tāya, nāsu,
analyzed: ṭā dese su nam hi suti dīghe ca kate āsam nāsam nāsānam tāsam tāsānaṃ sattamiyaṃassam  assā nassam nassā nāyam nāya tissam tissā tassam tassā tāyam tāya nāsu
translated: In the genitive case.🔽In the genative case of these words, the ending is either -e or -ā.🔽In the nominative case.

original: tāsu-napuṃsake-naṃ, taṃ, nāti, tāti, naṃ, taṃ,ne, nā, ni, te, tāni-nādisu pumeva-evametasaddassa
analyzed: tāsu napuṃsakenam tam nāti tāti nam taṃne nā ni te tāni nādisu pum eva evam eta saddassa
translated: In the nominative case of these words, the ending is either -e or -ā.🔽In the vocative case.🔽In the vocative case of these words, the ending is either -e or -ā.

original: tīsu liṅgesu-ṭanādesābhāvo’va viseso-imasi.
analyzed: tīsu
translated: This is the neuter of this.🔽This is the neuter of this word.🔽In the nominative case it is this, these, this, by this.

original: Simhi napuṃsakassāyaṃ.
analyzed: simhi napuṃsakassa ayam
translated: In the nominative case it is not this.🔽In the nominative case of this word the vowel a is not.🔽In the nominative case of this feminine it is these.🔽In the nominative case of this feminine it is these, these, by these, by these.

original: Imasaddassānapuṃsakassāyaṃ hotisimhi-ayaṃ, ime, imaṃ, imenā.🔽Nāmhinimi.
analyzed: ima saddassa a napuṃsakassa ayam hoti simhi ayam ime imam imena  nām hi nimi
translated: In the nominative case of this masculine it is this, these, by this, by these.🔽In the nominative case of this neuter it is this, these, by this, by these.

original: Imasaddassānitthiyaṃ nāmhi anैmiccādesā honti-anena, iminā-hi-🔽Imassā nitthiyaṃ ṭe.
analyzed: ima saddassa an itthiyam nāmhi an m it ca ādesāḥ honti anena iminā hi  imassā nitthiyam ṭe
translated: In the nominative case of this feminine it is this, these, by this, by these.🔽In the nominative case of this masculine it is this, these, by this, by these.🔽In the nominative case of this neuter it is this, these, by this, by these.

original: Imasaddassānitthiyaṃ ṭe hotivā sunaṃhisu-ehi, ehi, imehi, imehi-sa-ṭasasmāsmi miccādinā
analyzed: ima saddassa an itthiyam ṭe hoti vā su nam hi suehi ehi imehi imehi sa ṭasa sma asmi m it ca ādinā
translated: In the nominative case of this feminine it is this, these, by this, by these.🔽In the nominative case of this masculine it is this, these, by this, by these.🔽In the nominative case of this neuter it is this, these, by this, by these.🔽In the nominative case of this feminine it is this, these, by this, by these.🔽In the nominative case of this masculine it is this, these, by this, by these.

analyzed: nāmhi se ca a pāda ādaḥ vattamānānam padasma paresam ekavākye ṭhitānam tumha amha saddānam
translated: In the case of the words tumhaṃ and amhaṃ occurring in the same sentence with the words beginning with apādado,

original: savihattīnaṃ te me vā honti yathākkamaṃ-kataṃ te, kataṃ tayā, kataṃ me, kataṃ mayā-diyate
analyzed: sa vihattīnam te me vā honti yathākkamam katam te katam tayā katam me katam mayā ādiyate
translated: they are either te me or they are me, according as the case may be: done for you, done by you, done for me, done by me;

original: te, dīyate tava, dīyate me, diyate mama-dhanaṃ te, dhanaṃ tava, dhanaṃ me, dhanaṃ mama.
analyzed: te dīyate tava dīyate me diyate mamadhanam te dhanam tava dhanam me dhanam mama
translated: given to you, given to you, given to me, given to me; wealth of yours, wealth of yours, wealth of mine, wealth of mine.

original: Nacavāhāhevayoge.
analyzed: na ca vā ha aha iva yoge
translated: Not in the case of the words beginning with cavāhāha.

original: Cavāhaahaevehiyoge tumhaamhasaddānamādesāna honti. Gacchāma tumhe ca, mayañca-passati🔽tumhe ca, amhe ca-kataṃ tumhehi ca, amhehi ca-diyate tumhañca, amhañca-dhanaṃ tumhañca,
analyzed: ca vā aha aha eva ihi yoge honti gacchāma tumhe ca  tumhe ca amhe tumhehi ca amhehi cadiyate tumhan ca amhan ca dhanam tumhan ca
translated: In the case of the words beginning with cavāhāha, the words tumhaṃ and amhaṃ do not take the ādeso. We go, you and we;🔽he sees you and us;🔽done by you and by us; given to you and to us; wealth of yours and ours;

original: amhañca-kataṃ tayā ca, mayā ca-dīyate tava ca, mama ca-dhanaṃ tava ca mama ca-vādiyogepyevaṃ
analyzed: tayā ca mayā ca dīyate tava ca mama ca dhanam tava ca mama ca vādi yoge pi evam
translated: done by you and by me; given to you and to me; wealth of yours and mine.🔽In the same way in the case of the words beginning with vā.

original: ñeyyaṃ-ubha kati saddā bahuvacanattā-“ubhagohi ṭo“ti yonaṃ ṭo-ubho, ubho-suhisubhasso.
analyzed: kati saddāḥ bahuvacana ttā ubha go hi ṭaḥ ti yaḥ nam ṭaḥ ubhaḥ

original: Ubhassa suhisvo hoti-ubhohi ubhohi-🔽Ubhinnaṃ.

translated: The two, the two of them, the two of them, the two of you, the two of you, the two of us, the two of us.🔽The two, the two of them, the two of them, the two of you, the two of you, the two of us, the two of us.🔽The two, the two of them, the two of them, the two of you, the two of you, the two of us, the two of us.🔽The two, the two of them, the two of them, the two of you, the two of you, the two of us, the two of us.🔽The two, the two of them, the two of them, the two of you, the two of you, the two of us, the two of us.🔽The two, the two of them, the two of them, the two of you, the two of you, the two of us, the two of us.

original: Ubhā naṃvacanassa innaṃ hoti-ubhinnaṃ, ubhosu.🔽Ṭi katimhā
analyzed: ubhā naṃvacanassa innam hoti ubh innam ubhosu  ṭi katimhā
translated: The two, the two of them, the two of them, the two of you, the two of you, the two of us, the two of us.

original: Katimhāyonaṃṭi hoti-kati,kati,katīhi,katībhi, katinnaṃ katīsu.🔽Atha saṅkhyāsaddā vuccante.
analyzed: hoti kati kati katīhi katībhi katinnam katīsu  atha saṅkhyā saddāḥ vuccante
translated: The two, the two of them, the two of them, the two of you, the two of you, the two of us, the two of us.

original: Ekādayo aṭṭhārasantā saṅkheyyavacanā-vīsatiādayo pana saṅkhyānavacanāca-ekasaddo sabbādisu vuttova-dvādinamaṭṭhārasantānaṃ bahuvacanantattā ekavacanābhāvo-dvisaddā yomhi.🔽Yomhi dvinnaṃ duve dve.

translated: The two, the two of them, the two of them, the two of you, the two of you, the two of us, the two of us.🔽The two, the two of them, the two of them, the two of you, the two of you, the two of us, the two of us.🔽The two, the two of them, the two of them, the two of you, the two of you, the two of us, the two of us.

analyzed: na mhi dvissa savibhattissa duvinnam hoti vā a duvinnam aññatra 🔽namhi nuka dva ādīnam sattara santam
translated: The two, the two of them, the two of them, the two of you, the two of you, the two of us, the two of us.🔽The two, the two of them, the two of them, the two of you

original: Dvādīnaṃ sattarasannaṃ saṅkhyānaṃ nukhoti namhi vibhattimhi. Ukārouccāraṇattho-kakāro antāvayavattho-tena nambhīna dīgho-dvinnaṃ,dvīsu-tisaddā yomhi.🔽Pume tayo cattāro.🔽Yomhi savibhattīnaṃ tivatunnaṃ tayo cattāro honti yathākkamaṃ pulliṅge-tayo, tayo, tīhi, tībhi.🔽Ṇṇaṃ ṇṇannaṃ titojjhā.
analyzed: dva ādīnam saṅkhyānam nu kha iti namhi vibhattimhi ukāraḥ uccāraṇa tthaḥ kakāraḥ anta avayava tthaḥ tena dīghaḥ udvit naṃ dvī suti saddāḥ yaḥ mhi  pume tayo cattāro  sa vibhattīnam tiva tunnam tayaḥ cattāraḥ honti yathākkamam tayaḥ tīhi tībhi  ti tojjhā
translated: In the case of the two, the seven, the seven and ten, I am not a case-ending. The letter u is for the purpose of pronunciation; the letter k is for the purpose of the last part of a word; therefore I am not long; in the case of the two, in the two; in the case of the three, I am y.🔽In the masculine, three, four.🔽In the masculine, I am the case-ending of the three, the four, in the order, three, three, with three, with three.🔽In the neuter, three, four, five.🔽

analyzed: jha saññataḥ titaḥ naṃ vacanassa ṇ ṇ na naṃ honti ti ṇ naṃ tīsu itthīyam 🔽tissaḥ catassaḥ yaḥ omhi sa vibhattīnam 🔽vibhatti sahitānam tiva tunnam tissaḥ catassaḥ honti itthiyam yathā ākkamaṃtissaḥ tissaḥ tīhi tībhi 🔽namhi ti catunnam itthiyam tissa catassā 🔽namhi ti catunnam catassāḥ honti itthiyam tīsu napuṃsake 🔽tīṇi cattāri napuṃsake

original: Caturo vā catussa.
analyzed: caturaḥ vā
translated: I am the four of the four cases, in the feminine.🔽I am the four of the four cases, in the feminine, when the case-ending is attached.🔽I am the ṭa of the five and so on up to the fourteen.🔽I am the ṭa of the case-ending, when the number is five and so on up to fourteen.

original: Catusaddassa savibhattissa yomhi caturo vā hoti pulliṅge-caturo, caturo-aññatra-cattāro, cattāro-catūhi catūbhi.🔽Ṭa pañcādīhi cuddasahi.
