original: Ñottā suṃ.🔽Ñādesato oādesato ca parassa umiccassa suṃ vā hoti-apācayasuṃ pācayasuṃ apācesuṃ
analyzed: ñaḥ uttā sum  ña ādesataḥ o ādesataḥ ca parassa um iccassa sum vā hoti apācayasum pācayasum apācesum
translated: The past tense.🔽The past tense and the past participle of the verb umi, to desire, have the form su, when the prefix a or o is added-apācayasuṃ, pācayasuṃ, apācesuṃ,🔽pācesuṃ, apācayuṃ, pācayumiccādi. The difference is only in the u.

original: pācesuṃ apācayuṃ pācayumiccādi-ussa sumeva viseso-kamme-apācīyittho pācīyittho apācīyattho
analyzed: pācesum apācayum pācayum iccā di ussa sum eva
translated: In the passive voice-apācīyittho, pācīyittho, apācīyattho,

original: pācīyattho apāciyi pācīyi apāciyī pācīyi iccādi-anajjatane-apācayattha pācayattha🔽apācettha kapācettha apācaya pācaya apācayā pācayā apācayu pācayu apācayū pācayū
analyzed: pācīyatthaḥ apāciyi pācīyi apāciyi pācīyi icca ādi an ajja tane a pācayattha pācayattha  apācettha kapācettha apācaya pācaya apācayā pācayā apācayu pācayu apācayū pācayū
translated: pācīyattho, apāciyi, pācīyi, apāciyī, pācīyi iccādi. In the aorists-apācayattha, pācayattha,🔽apācettha, kapācettha, apācaya, pācaya, apācayā, pācayā, apācayu, pācayu, apācayū, pācayū iccādi.

original: iccādi-kamme-apācīyattha pācīyattha apācīya pācīya apācīyā pācīyā iccādi-parokkhe-
analyzed: icca ādi kamme apācīyattha pācīyattha apācīya pācīya apācīyā pācīyā icca ādi parokkhe
translated: In the passive voice-apācīyattha, pācīyattha, apācīya, pācīya, apācīyā, pācīyā iccādi. In the optative mood-

original: Rasso pubbassa.
analyzed: rassaḥ pubbassa
translated: The vowel r is lengthened before a double consonant.

original: Dvitte pubbassa saro rasso hoti-papācaya papācayu papācaye papācayittha papācettha
analyzed: dvitte pubbassa saro rassaḥ hoti papācaya papācayu papācaye papācayittha papācettha
translated: The vowel r is lengthened before a double consonant-papācaya, papācayu, papācaye, papācayittha, papācettha iccādi.

original: iccādi-kamme-sabbaṃ kattusamaṃ-atapattiyaṃapācayissa pācayissa apācayissā pācayissā
analyzed: i cca ādi kamma isabbam kattu samam ata pattiyam apācayissa pācayissa apācayissā pācayissā
translated: In the passive voice-all is the same as in the active voice. In the imperative mood-apācayissa, pācayissa, apācayissā, pācayissā,🔽apācayissatha, pācayissatha, apācayissāma, pācayissāma iccādi.

original: apācayissaṃsu pācayissaṃsu iccādi-kamme-apāciyissa pāciyissa apācīyissā pāciyissa
analyzed: apācayissaṃsu pācayissaṃsu icca ādi kamme apāciyissa pāciyissa apācīyissā pāciyissa
translated: apāciyissa pāciyissa apācīyissā pāciyissa🔽apācissa pācissa apācissā pācissā etc. in the Causal.

original: apācissa pācissa apācissā pācissā iccādi-hetuphalesu-pācaye pācayeyya pācayuṃ pācayeyayumiccādi-kamme-pācīye
analyzed: apācissa pācissa apācissā pācissā iccādi hetu phale su pācaye pācayeyya pācayum
translated: pācaye pācayeyya pācayuṃ pācayeyayum etc. in the Aorist.🔽pācīye pācīyeyayum etc. in the Conditional.🔽pācayatu pācetu pācayantu pācentu etc. in the Aorist.

original: pācīyeyayumiccādi-tvādisu-pācayatu pācetu pācayantu pācentu iccādi-kamme-pācīyatu
analyzed: pācīyeyayum icca ādi tvādi su pācayatu pācetu pācayantu pācentu icca ādi kammepācīyatu
translated: pācīyatu pācīyantu etc. in the Conditional.🔽pācāpayati pācāpeti etc. in the Causative.🔽pācayitumpayutti etc. in the Infinitive.

original: pācīyantu iccādi-ṇapimhi-pācāpayati pācāpeticcādi nyantasamaṃ-pācayitumpayuttiti ṇyantatopi ṇi.
analyzed: pācīyantu it ca ādi ṇapi mhi pācāpayati nyanta samam pācayitum payuttiti ṇi antataḥ pi ṇi
translated: The ṇi is also by the ṇi of pācayati.

original: Ṇiṇapinaṃ tesu.
analyzed: ṇi ṇa pinam tesu
translated: The ṇi and ṇap are in those.🔽The ṇī and ṇap are elided, not the na, in those ṇī and ṇap.

original: Ṇī ṇapinaṃ lopo nahoti tesu ṇī ṇapisu’tika pubbaṇilope-pācayati pāceticcādi sabbatthañeyyaṃ-ṇapicevaṃ.
analyzed: ṇī ṇapinam lopaḥ na hoti tesu ṇī ṇapi sutika pubba ṇi lope pācayati pāca iti ca ādi sabbattha ñeyyam ṇapi ca evam
translated: pācayati pāceti etc. are to be known everywhere.

original: Bhuvādi nayo.
analyzed: bhuva ādi nayo
translated: The ṇap is like this.🔽Now, in order to show the division of the verbal roots, the forms of the root kri, which is the first of the Rudhādi group, are stated:

original: Adhunā vikaraṇappabhedappakāsanatthaṃ rudhādīnaṃ aṭāṭhagaṇanamādibhutassekekassa kriyatthassa kāni ci rūpāni udāhariyante-rudha āvaraṇe-tyādi.
analyzed: adhunā vikaraṇa ppabheda ppakāsana ttham rudh ādīnam kriyatthassa kāni rūpāni āvaraṇa ityādi
translated: rudha in the sense of covering etc.

original: Mañca rudhādīnaṃ.
analyzed: mañca rudhā dīnam
translated: The mañca is of the Rudhādi group.

original: Rudhādito aparokkhesukattuvihitamānantatyādisu lohoti mañcāntasarā paro-rundhati
analyzed: rudh ādeḥ mañca antasarā parorundhati
translated: In the passive of such verbs as rudhā, aparokkha, kattu, vihita, anantatya, etc., the form is maṃcāntasarā paro-rundhati,

original: rundhare rundhanticcādi-kamme-“maṃ vā rudhādīna”nti vā maṃ-rundhiyati rujjhatīcacādi-paciviya sabbattha ñeyyaṃ.
analyzed: vā vā sabbattha ñeyyam
translated: rundhare, rundhanticcādi. In the causative, “maṃ vā rudhādīna” means maṃ-rundhiyati, rujjhati, etc. In the passive of paci, the form is viya, and in all verbs it should be known thus.

original: Rudhādi nayo.
analyzed: rudh ādi nayoḥ
translated: The method of rudhā, etc.

original: Diva kīḷā vijigiṃsā vohārajjuti thuti gatīsu.
analyzed: kīḷā vijigiṃsā vohā rajjuti thuti gatīsu
translated: In the sense of “play by day,” “desire to conquer,” “usage,” “light,” “praise,” and “going,”

original: Divādīhi yaka.
analyzed: divā dīhi yaka
translated: the form is yaka with divas, etc.

original: Divādīhi lavisaye yaka hoti-kakāro kānubandhakāriyattho-evamuparica-dibbati dibbare dibbanticcādi-kamme-kivīyati dibbati divīyare diviyanti dibbare dibbanticcādi.🔽Divādi nayo.🔽Tuda vyathane.
analyzed: diva ādīhi la visaye yaka hoti kakāraḥ ka anubandha kāriya tthaḥ evam upari ca dibbati dibbare dibbanti icca ādi kamme kivīyati dibbati divīyare diviyanti dibbare dibbanti cca ādi  div ādi nayo  tuda vyathane
translated: The letter ka in yaka has the meaning of “causing.” In the same way, the forms are dibbati, dibbare, dibbanticcādi,🔽dibbati, dibbare, dibbanticcādi.

original: Tudādīhi ko.🔽Tudādīhi lavisaye ko hoti-tudati tudanticcādi-kamme-tudīyati tujjati tudīyaretudiyanti tujjare tudyanticcādi.
analyzed: tud ādi īhi kaḥ  tud ādīhi la visaye kaḥ hoti tudati tudanti icca ādi kamme tudīyati tujjati tudīyare tudiyanti tujjare tudyanti cca ādi
translated: The method of divas, etc.🔽In the sense of “pain,”🔽the form is ko with tud, etc.🔽The letter ko in ko has the meaning of “causing.” In the same way, the forms are tudati, tudanticcādi,🔽tudīyati, tujjati, tudīyaretudiyanti, tujjare, tudyanticcādi.

original: Tudādi nayo.🔽Ji jaye.
analyzed: tud ādi nayo  ji jaye
translated: The method of tud, etc.🔽In the sense of “conquering,”

original: Jyādīhi ktā.
analyzed: jyā ādi hi ktā
translated: the form is ktā with jya, etc.🔽The letter ktā in ktā has the meaning of “causing.” In the same way, the forms are jināti, jinanticcādi,

original: Jiādīhi kalavisaye knā hoti-jināti jinanticcādi-kamme-jiyati jiyare jiyanticcādi.
analyzed: ji ādīhi kala visaye hoti jināti jinanti icca ādi kamme jiyati jiyare jiyanti cca ādi
translated: jināti, jinanticcādi.

original: Jyādi nayo.
analyzed: jyā ādi nayoḥ
translated: The same method with jyādi.

original: Kī dabbavinīmaye.
analyzed: kī dap ba vi nī maye
translated: Kī is kīyati in the passive.

original: Kyādīhi kṇā.
analyzed: kya ādi hi kṇā
translated: Kyādi is kṇā.

original: Kīādīhī lavisaye kaṇā hoti.
analyzed: la visaye kaṇā hoti
translated: Kīādi is kaṇā in the passive.

original: Nāṇasu rasso.
analyzed: nāṇasu rassaḥ
translated: Nāṇasu is rasso.

original: Nāṇasu kriyatthassa rasso hoti-kiṇati kiṇanticcādi-kamme-kīyati kīyare kīyanticcādī.
analyzed: nāṇasu kriya tthassa rassaḥ hoti kiṇati kiṇanti cca ādi kamme kīyati kīyare kīyanti cca ādī
translated: Nāṇasu is rasso in the sense of the meaning of action: kiṇati, kiṇanti, etc.; in the passive: kīyati, kīyare, kīyanticcādi.

original: Kyādi nayo.
analyzed: kya ādi nayoḥ
translated: The same method with kyādi.

original: Su savaṇe.
analyzed: su savaṇe
translated: Su is suṇeti.

original: Svādīhi keṇā.
analyzed: svādīhi keṇa
translated: Svādīhi is keṇā.

original: Svādīhi lavisaye keṇā hoti-suṇeti suṇanticcādi. Kamme-sūyati sūyare sūyanticcādi.
analyzed: su ādīhi la visaye keṇā hotisuṇeti suṇanticca ādi kammesūyati sūyare sūyanticca ādi
translated: Svādīhi is keṇā in the passive: suṇeti, suṇanti, etc.; in the passive: sūyati, sūyare, sūyanticcādi.

original: Svādi nayo.
analyzed: su ādi nayoḥ
translated: The same method with svādi.

original: Tana vitthāre.
analyzed: tana vitthāre
translated: Tana is tanonti.

original: Tanāditvo.
analyzed: tan ādi tvaḥ
translated: Tanāditto.

original: Tanādīhi lavisaye o hoti-tanoti tanonticcādi. Paracchakke.
analyzed: tana ādīhi la visaye o hoti tanoti tanonti cca ādi parat śakke
translated: Tanādi is o in the passive: tanoti, tanonticcādi. Paracchakke.

original: Ovikaraṇassu paracchakke.
analyzed: o vikaraṇassu paracchakke
translated: Ovikaraṇassu paracchakke.

original: Ovikaraṇassa u hoti paracchakkavisaye-tanute tatvante iccādi-kamme-
analyzed: o vikaraṇassa u hoti tat vante icca ādi kamme
translated: Ovikaraṇassa is u in the passive in the sense of paracchakka: tanute, tatvante, etc.; in the passive:

original: Tanassā vā.
analyzed: tanassāḥ vā
translated: Tanassā vā.

original: Tanassa ā hoti vā kye-tāyati taññāti tāyare tāyanti taññare taññanticcāndi.
analyzed: tanassa ā hoti vā
translated: Tanassa is ā in the passive in the sense of kye: tāyati, taññāti, tāyare, tāyanti, taññare, taññanticcāndi.

original: Tanādi nayo.
analyzed: tan ādi nayoḥ
translated: The same method with tanādi.

original: Vūra theyye.
analyzed: vūra theyye
translated: Vūra is theyye.

original: Curādito ṇi.
analyzed: curā t itaḥ ṇi
translated: Curādito ṇi.

original: Curādīhi kriyattehi sakatthe ṇi paro hoti bahulaṃ-corayati corati corayare corayanticorenticcādi-kamme-coriyati corīyare corīyanticcādi.
analyzed: cur ādīhi sa katthe ṇi paraḥ hoti bahulam corayati corati corayare corayanti corenti cca ādi kamme coriyati corīyare corīyanti cca ādi
translated: The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.

original: Curādi nayo-tyādayo.🔽Paratthāya mayā laddhaṃ katvāna padasādhanaṃ
analyzed: curādi naya uti ādayaḥ  paratthāya mayā laddham pada sādhanam
translated: The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.

original: Puññena tena loko’yaṃ sādhetu padamaccunaṃ;🔽Suddhāsayena parisuddhaguṇeditena
analyzed: puññena tena lokaḥ oyam sādhetu  suddha āsayena parisuddha guṇa editena
translated: The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.

original: Sārena sārayatisaṅghanisevitena🔽Ramme’nurādhanagare vasatambujena🔽Vidvālitaṃ nijavisuddha kuladdhajena;
analyzed: sārena sārayati saṅgha nisevitena  ramme nurādha nagare vasa tambujena  vidvālitam nija visuddha
translated: The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.

original: Mānentena tathāgataṃ paṭipadāyogena saddhālunā
analyzed: mānentena tathāgatam paṭipadā yogena saddhālunā
translated: The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.

original: Niccākhaṇḍatapo’nalehi nikhilappāpārisantāpitā🔽Saddhammavhayasīhatelaṭhatiyā cāmīkaratthālinā
analyzed: cāmīkara tthālinā
translated: The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.

original: Nānāvādikudiṭṭhibhedapaṭunā navāṇi kanavadhū sāminā;🔽Satthānaṃ karuṇavatā gatavatā kapāramparaṃ dhīmatā
analyzed: nānā vādi ku diṭṭhi bheda paṭunā navāṇi sāminā  satthānam karuṇavatā gatavatā ka pāramparam dhīmatā
translated: The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.🔽The Tena-ādi-niddesa is finished.

original: Therenātumapādapañjaragato yo saddasattādisu
analyzed: yaḥ sad dasat tā ādisu
translated: The Tena-ādi-niddesa

original: Moggallāyanavissutetiha suvacchāpo vinīto kayathā🔽So’kāsī piyadassi nāma yatidaṃ byattaṃ sukhappattiyā;🔽Vuttova vuttamupabhoginiyā sakāya
analyzed: suvacchāpaḥ  soka āsī piyadassi nāma yatidam byattam sukha ppattiyā  vuttaḥ uva vuttam upabhoginiyā sakāya
translated: The one called Piyadassi, who was well-trained, who was well-spoken, who was well-disciplined,🔽Who was able to attain happiness,

original: Pinappayodharavanāpagasevikāya🔽Ramhāvihāravadhuyā tilakātulena
analyzed: pinappayodhara vanāpaga sevikāya  ramhā vihāra vadhuyā tilaka atulena
translated: Who was spoken of by the one who enjoyed what was said,🔽By the one who served the breasts of his mother and aunt,🔽By the one who was like a crest-jewel to the young women of Rāma’s monastery,

original: Santena kappiṇasamavhayamātulena;
analyzed: santena
translated: By the one who was peaceful, who was like a relative, who was like an uncle,

original: Padasādhanaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.
analyzed: pada sādhanam niṭṭhitam
translated: The explanation of the words is finished.
